loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 38 años de edad,es madre soltera de 3 hijos pero vive solamente con una de sus hijas en su casa propia.Teresa se dedica a la venta de ropa de distintos sexos, modelos, tamaños y colores tanto para damas, caballero y niños. De manera periódica realiza la compra de su mercadería , la misma que pone a la venta en los pueblos que se encuentran cerca del río. Todas sus ventas son al contado y la realiza junto a una señorita.Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque le permite conocer nuevos clientes y generar sus propios ingresos económicos tambien ha visto que sus ganancias son muy buenas y es por eso que desea colocar una tienda destina a este negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1500, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante con su negocio ,razón por la cual se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de prendas de vestir conformada por polos, jeans, pantalones, blusas, camisas y shorts para ponerlos a la venta entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa is 38 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children. However, she lives with only one of her daughters. She lives in her own home.

Teresa sells ladies', men's and children's clothes of different styles, sizes and colours of clothes. She purchases her merchandise on a periodic basis. She sells this merchandise in the villages close to the river. 

All of her sales are cash sales. Another young woman works with her. She enjoys her work a lot because she gets to meet new customers and to generate her own income. She sees that her earnings are very good and for this reason she would like to add to her business a shop where her customers can go.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan of S/ 1500. She is very grateful for this financial opportunity and for the financial support which she requires to ensure her business gets ahead. For this reason, she is committed to making all her payments on time. With the amount requested she will buy a load of clothes comprising polo shirts, jeans, trousers, blouses, shirts and shorts, which she will offer for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as polo shirts, jeans, trousers and blouses

loans.name: Ana Elena

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ana, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar un computador, que le permitió mejorar el servicio y sus ingresos. Con esta inversión y mejora, su negocio se ha mantenido, pudiendo con ello contribuir con el sostenimiento de su hogar. Actualmente requiere la compra de una fotocopiadora para ampliar su oferta de servicio a sus clientes. Por esta razón acude a un nuevo credikiva que le ayude a lograr esta meta. Nuevamente les extiende sus agradecimientos por prestarles estos servicios.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support given to Ana, who used her Kiva loan to buy a computer, she was able to improve her service as well as her income. With this investment and improvement, Ana was able to maintain her business and contribute toward the support of her household.

At the moment, she is requesting to purchase a photocopier so that she can expand her offering of services to her customers. For this reason, she is applying for a new Kiva loan so that she can accomplish this goal. Once again, she expresses her appreciation for these services.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier so that she can begin offering an additional service.

loans.name: Norith

texts.es: Norith tiene 53 años de edad es una mujer casada y vive acompañada de su esposo, de sus 2 hijos y una nietecita.Lleva 30 años desempeñándose como docente de inicial en el jardín de su pueblo, siendo está su principal actividad económica, como un complemento para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la ganadería, todos los fines de semana se dirige junto a su esposo a sus tierras a sacar leche de los ganados para luego venderlos a la planta. Con los ahorros que tenia de la venta de la leche logro comprar una mototaxi junto a su esposo, para trasladarse a sus terrenos el cual está ubicado a una hora de su vivienda.Con la ganancia que obtiene de la venta de leche y con los ahorros que tiene espera comprar más ganado para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ventas.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que se le brinda para seguir adelante , razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Norith is 53 years old, married, and lives with her husband, two children and granddaughter.  For 30 years, she has been working as the head teacher in the town garden.  Although this is her main form of income, in order to complement this income, she also raises cattle.  Every weekend, along with her husband, she goes to her fields to milk the cows and later sell it.  With the money she had saved from selling milk, her and her husband were able to purchase a motorcycle to travel to their farm which is an hours from their home.

With the earnings from her milk sales and her savings, she hopes to purchase more cattle to increase her production and improve her sales.  This is her first Kiva loan, and she is very grateful for the financial support she has received to continue striving to succeed, which is why she is committed to pay back the loan in a timely manner.  She is requesting 1500 Soles which she will invest in the purchase of a cow to increase her production.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan,  se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en la tienda que posee; este le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica tales como: golosinas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, jabón, papel higiénico, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus inventarios y con ello obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas se han optimizado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Juan needs more working capital to keep investing in his shop. This will allow him to purchase basic products such as candy, rice, beans, sugar, salt, soap, toilet paper, etc. 
The previous loan helped him to improve his supplies and increase his income. Economic conditions have improved and his family's situation is stable.

loans.use: to purchase candy, rice, beans, sugar, salt, soap, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Salom

texts.ru: Салом житель района Рудаки. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и является отцом двоих детей. У него взрослый сын и дочь. Его жена дома занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. У Салома среднее техническое образование. Сейчас он хочет заняться услугой маршрутного такси. Он имеет рабочий опыт в этой сфере. Чтобы начать деятельность ему необходимо купить машину. У него есть сбережение, но чтобы осуществить свое намерение ему не хватает 1000 долларов. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом и надеется, что его цель реализуется с вашей поддержкой.
texts.en:
Salom is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is 50 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. He has a grown son and daughter. His wife provides sewing services from their home. Salom has a technical high school education. 

Now, he wants to provide a route taxi service. He has working experience in this field. In order to start activities, he needs to buy a car. He has savings, but in order to carry out his intention he lacks USD$1,000. Therefore, he applied for a loan and hopes that his goal will be realized with your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to offer taxi services

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор замужняя женщина. Ей 42 года. Гулбахор мать троих сыновей. Она со своей семьей проживает в районе Спитамен. Муж Гулбахор работает в России на стройке, а её старший сын работает продавцом на рынке района. Сама Гулбахор имеет среднее образование. Она работает в Текстильной фабрике в качестве оператора  2-го разряда. Кроме этого Гулбахор занимается сельским хозяйством. Чтобы улучшить условия проживания в семье, Гулбахор намерена заняться бизнесом, а именно купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа 3-х голов крупно-рогатого скота с целью дальнейшего их откорма и продажи. У нее имеются все условия для разведения скота.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a married woman. She is 42 years old. Gulbahor is the mother of three sons. She and her family reside in the Spitamen region. Gulbahor's husband works in Russia in construction, and her eldest son works as a trader in the market district. Gulbahor herself has a high school education. She works in a textile factory as an operator, 2nd class. 

In addition, Gulbahor is engaged in agriculture. To improve living conditions for her family, Gulbahor intends to do business, namely buying and selling cattle. 

She is requesting a loan to buy three heads of cattle in order to fatten and resell them. She has all the conditions for raising cattle.

loans.use: to buy three heads of cattle

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en: Remegia is 61 years old, married, and has seven children. She resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City.  Remegia provides entertainment by operating a videokey machine to earn a living. Remegia engaged in this business to help her husband support the family. As a result, she was able to earn about 3,000 PHP a month. Recently, she requested an amount of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to repair her karaoke machine and buy a new microphone. Remegia plans to improve their house to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to repair her karaoke machine and buy a new microphone.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 55-year-old Rugiatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 15 and 35.  For the past 30 years, Rugiatu has been running her food commodities business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her family's standard of living. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and transportation cost.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more gari, flour and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gari, flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 37, operates a business selling soft drinks by the crate. She started her venture with savings that she gathered over several years, and she has been running her business for the past five years. As she is the most successful person in her family, they depend upon her for support. She has earned a great deal of respect through her business and she is proud of her success. 

Rose lives in the St. Paul area of  Montserrado County with her husband and their three children. The children are between the ages of 10 and 18 years old and are all attending school. Rose herself did not have the opportunity to attend school, and her goal is to see her children attain a university education.

Rose cites poor road conditions leading to her shop as a major business obstacle, as she believes she is losing income due to this problem. She would like eventually to open an additional shop in the market.

Rose is requesting a loan in order to purchase a very large quantity of crates of soft drinks to offer for sale. Her plan for the future is to secure her children's university educations, establish another shop, and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of crates of soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Zinnah

texts.en: Zinnah is 49 years old and lives in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area one of the most heavily-populated areas of Montserrado county and has some of the country's highest living standards.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South a popular place to live. Zinnah is a widow and has five children between 25 and 12 years of age. Only two of them are still enrolled in school, and he has earned a living for the last eight years by running a shop in the local market where he sells trousers, jeans, blouses and other clothing items. The main problem he faces is the rainy season, which means fewer customers and a smaller income. He says his business gains him respect and makes him proud, because he can take care of his family expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. His goals are to get three of his children through university-level education and then build a house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mariatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 years and 15 years.

Mariatu runs an eatery; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business 11 hours per day and six days per week. Her husband is not working, so she takes the responsibility all by herself. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to run the business.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy more food item such as palm oil, cooking seasonings and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living standard by serving her family three meals every day and increasing her business. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items such as palm oil, cooking seasonings and rice

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is in her late forties and married with seven children, ages 2 to 25 years. She runs a food stand business in Jui eastern area in Freetown. Three of her children are going to school. She started this business because she did not go to school and she was trained in business.

To earn a living, she’s been in this business for more than 15 years and sells peppers and vegetables within a busy market area.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price increase and slow purchasing power of customers.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more peppers and vegetables to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers and vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 15, 16, 18 y 20 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero.  El se dedica a la agricultura y también  es  molinero, el oficio lo aprendió desde pequeño y piensa en colocar un molino propio para obtener mayores ingresos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá invertir en dos manzanas de tierra para llevar a cabo la siembra de pipián, por lo cual comprara abono, herbicidas, insecticidas,  pesticidas y preparación de la tierra; este le ayudara a generar mejores utilidades en su familia, uno de los riesgos seria el cambio de clima.
Su sueño es adquirir mayores ingresos y ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: Raúl lives with his family, his wife and four children, who are 15, 16, 18, and 20 years old. He does not have family members abroad. He is a farmer and also a miller. He learned the work from the time he was young, and he is thinking of putting in his own mill in order to earn more income. The loan he needs will allow him to invest in two manzanas of land (a manzana is about 7000 square meters) in order to plant pipián (a type of squash), for which he will buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide, and prepare the land. This will help him to earn more income for his family. One of the risks would be climate change. His dream is to earn more income and expand his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide, and to prepare the land

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Elizabeth from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has two children between the ages of 1 and 10. One of her children is attending school. Elizabeth was a student, but she dropped out at an early age. She started a business to improve her standard of living.

Elizabeth sells general supplies, such as eggs, slippers, and waxed cotton. She has been running this business for seven years. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. Elizabeth says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Elizabeth has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as eggs, slippers, and waxed cotton for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her child's school fees. In the future, she plans to further her education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, slippers, and waxed cotton

loans.name: Emma Rufina

texts.es: La Sra. Emma  tiene 25 años y es casada con dos hijos que son de las edades de 1 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y frutas en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de la Rodríguez,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Emma utilizara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como refrescos, dulces, abarrotes y galletas para surtir su tienda de barrio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad  de ampliar  y surtir su tienda de barrio, la Sra. Emma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Su deseo con el tiempo es tener su propio almacén y así de esta manera generar más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Emma is 25 years old, married, and has two children (ages 1 and 4). She sells basic necessity products and fruit at her neighborhood store located in the District of Rodríguez. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender.

Sra. Emma will use this loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, sweets, groceries, and cookies to restock her neighborhood store. The reason why she is requesting the loan is because she needs to expand and restock her store. Sra. Emma confronts challenges in her business, such as increasing her clientele. Her profits will be used to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She hopes in time to have her own warehouse so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, groceries, and cookies to restock her store.

loans.name: Madres Puntuales De San Juan Group

texts.es: La Sra. María es viuda  y tiene más de 5 años con Edaprospo.  Tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 2 aun son dependientes. María se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 7 años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido salir adelante dándole así una mejor  calidad de vida a su familia. También se dedica a la venta de comida los días sábados   y domingos.  Actualmente su ingreso lo destina para cubrir los gastos de vestimenta,  servicios y  de alimentación de su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es tener un negocio mucho más grande y que se encuentre ubicado dentro de una zona mucho más comercial, y que su hija estudie una carrera universitaria. Ella usara  el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. María pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Madres Puntuales de San Juan”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas. Ella lleva el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en:
María is a widow and has been with Edaprospo for over 5 years.  She has 8 children, 2 of which are dependent on her.  Maria has been selling groceries for the past 7 years.  With her efforts and work she has been able to get ahead and giver her family and better quality of life.  She also sells food on Saturdays and Sundays.  Currently she uses her income to cover clothing, service and food costs at home.  

Her plan for the future is to expand her business, to move it to a much more commercial area, and for her daughter to study at a university.  She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.  María belongs to the "Madres Puntuales de San Juan" communal bank, which is made up of 6 members.  Maria is the president of the organization.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for their business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, age 50, is a student at Yerevan State Institute of Theater and Cinema. She earns an income as an employee at a local company, but she has always dreamed of becoming a producer, and she is now taking classes to bring that dream to reality. 

She lives with her husband, son, and daughter-in-law in Yerevan. Her monthly income is enough to cover her family's daily expenses, but she requires additional funds in order to pay her university costs. She has applied for this loan so that she can pay her tuition. 

This loan is important for Gayane because it will allow her to complete her education, get her diploma, and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Hannah, who lives in the town of Jui, which is in the eastern area in Freetown. She is single and the mother of two children who are 2 and 9 years old. She has three additional dependents who have come to live with her from another village. Hannah runs a business where she sells palm oil, charcoal and various food items. She has been in this business for four years and works 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge she faces is insufficient capital to run her business. Hannah has requested a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. The extra income that she earns from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and grow her business. Her goal for the future is to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Mayra mujer de 37 años, casada, con tres hijos menores, desde hace trece años tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, de estar en la institución tiene de ser cliente tres años consecutivos lo que a demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carnes de res, carne de pollo, papel higiénico, plagatox, sopas maggi, maicena, gaseosas variadas, medicamentos populares, café presto, etc. Isabel tiene 61 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Pabla tiene 33 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising ladies.  Mayra is one of them.  She is 37 years old, married, and has three young children.  She has had a general food store in her home for thirteen years, and has been involved with the institution for three years, during which time she has demonstrated to be responsible with her payments.  She will use the money from this loan to buy grains such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, bathroom tissue, Plagatox products, Maggi soups, instant corn drinks, soft drinks, popular medicines, Presto coffee, etc.

Isabel is 61 years old and her store is located in her home as well.  Paula is 33 years old and she makes and sells tortillas.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diversidad de ropa tales como: bóxer, camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones, zapatos, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus utilidades; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan because she needs more operating capital in order to continue investing in her business. This will enable her to buy a variety of clothing such as boxers, shirts, blouses, skirts, trousers, shoes, and other items.

Her previous loan helped to increase her profits. As a result, her financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy boxers, shirts, blouses, skirts, trousers, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos para obtener ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El prestamo que requiere  le permitirá comprar productos para la comida tales como: carnes, pollo, cebolla, chiles, tomates, repollo, condimentos, entre otros.
Su sueño es tener una mejor estabilidad y aumentar  las utilidades para ofrecerle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her family. She works selling food items to earn income and have a better quality of life.

The loan that she needs will allow her to buy products for making food, such as meats, chicken, onions, chiles, tomatoes, cabbage, and condiments, among others.

Her dream is to have greater stability and to increase her earnings so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy meats, chicken, onions, chiles, tomatoes, cabbage, and condiments.

loans.name: Franklin Ernesto

texts.es:
Franklin, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la producción y sus ingresos los invierte para los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, aumento un miembro en la familia.
texts.en:
Franklin needs to take out a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue growing staple grains. This will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, among other items.

The previous loan helped him to increase production, and he used his income for household expenses. His family's economic conditions and circumstances have improved, and there is a new member of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, among other items

loans.name: Musukala J.

texts.en:
Please meet 29-year-old Musukala from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-Port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Musukala completed the 11 grade and is married.  Her husband is a gas seller.  Musukala owns her own 'lappa' business selling lappa (traditional cloth) for the past six years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more goods. 
 
On average, Musukala works 9 hours at her business.  She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites slow buying as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes.  In the future, she would like to own a house.  
She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
This is Larisa's second loan with Kiva. She is still engaged in the agricultural business with her husband in the village of Tsakhkunk, which is in the Sevan area. Her first loan really helped her to overcome some difficulties with her farm - she bought a lot of fodder for her animals as well as two calves, and has received a good profit. She also continues to grow wheat in her plot of land and sell it to re-sellers. Larisa’s family members are hardworking people and they have never avoided the difficulties that are in the agricultural business. 

Larisa decided to increase the number of her sheep and to repair the barn for the animals. For that she asks for a second loan from Kiva and hopes that this new loan will have the same success for her as the previous one.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and repair the barn for the animals

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion's source of income is her hog-raising business. She has been running this type of business for more than 15 years. Purificacion is 60 years old, married, and has been blessed with four grown-up children.

Purificacion seeks additional capital of PHP 5,000. This amount will be used to buy livestock supplies, such as hog feed and vaccines to make her pigs healthier. She hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be approved, so she could meet her family's basic needs and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies, such as hog feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en: Eleanor is 27 years old, married and the mother of three children who range in age from 2 to 10 years old. She earns a living by selling palm oil in the Jui area of eastern Freetown. Her children are all in school. She started this business because she did was not able to get an education but did learn how to sell palm oil. She has been in this line of work for more than 15 years and sells her product in a busy market area.  She says that the main challenges she faces are price increases and customers who have trouble paying their bills. Eleanor has requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more palm oil to sell. She says that the extra income she makes from this loan will help her grow her business and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she would like to continue to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Samuel Eugenio

texts.es:
Samuel, tiene 54 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 50 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, uno de ellos les ayuda en el negocio y el otro estudia bachillerato. El se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, el oficio lo aprendió de familia y  lleva diez años de poseerlo, lo realiza todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar pollos, gallinas, vitaminas y concentrado para engordarlas; este le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mas ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 54 years old. He is married and his spouse is 50 years old. They have two children. One of them helps them in their business and the other is in high school. He works raising poultry, which he learned from his family and has spent ten years doing. He works at it every day.

The loan that he needs will allow him to buy chickens, hens, vitamins and feed to fatten them. This will help him to increase his inventory and earn more income.

His dream is to strengthen his business and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens, vitamins and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, vive con su compañera de vida y no tienen hijos y ni familiares en el extranjero.  El se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, oficio que lo aprendió con sus padres y lo realiza desde hace diez años de 7:00am a 2:00pm, no tiene mayores dificultades para desempeñarlo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para llevar cabo el cultivo de maíz y frijol,  tales como: herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, abono; este le ayudara a darle una mejor mantenimiento al cultivo, obtener una mejor cosecha.
Su sueño es adquirir mayores ingresos y con ello brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, crear un record crediticio fiable y seguir trabajando con la Institución.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his partner. They do not have children or family members abroad. He grows staple grains. He learned the work from his parents and he has done it for ten years, working from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. He does not have great difficulty doing the work.

The loan he needs will let him buy agricultural supplies necessary to grow corn and beans such as herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and fertilizer. This will help him to better maintain his crops and obtain a better harvest.

His dream is to earn more income and with it give his family a better quality of life, to establish a reliable credit history, and to continue working with the Institution.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicides, pesticides, manure and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, beans, beef, chicken, creme cheese filling, and deep fried pork skin.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Aminata from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 years and 15 years. Two of her children are attending school. She started her business because she wanted to generate income to support her needs.

Aminata runs a local restaurant business; she sells snacks, fried chicken and bean salad. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities like including mayonnaise, ketchup, cooking seasonings and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase foods including mayonnaise, ketchup, cooking seasonings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: This is Rebecca, a 57-years-old seller of vegetables and cooking oil, and a single parent of two. She resides in the Teshie community. She has been in business for the past eight years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet, when it comes to her business. She became a partner of ID Ghana in the year 2010. This is Rebecca's fifth loan, and she needs the amount of GHS 1,200. She will use it to expand her business, by buying more vegetables and cooking oil, to resell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and cooking oil, to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a business selling a variety of foods, for snacks. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month, doing this work. Elizabeth has requested a loan for additional capital. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food to cook and sell, with the additional capital provided by the loan

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo prestamo por la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en la tienda y venta de ropa; este le permitirá comprar aceite, azucar, frijoles, arroz, sal entre otros y ropa para bebes, pantalones, blusas, camisas, chores, overol, entre otros; este le ayudara a adquirir más utilidades en el negocio.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias a la inversion del credito otorgado por Kiva.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her store and clothing sales. This will allow her to buy oil, sugar, beans, rice, and salt, among other items, as well as baby clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, and overalls, among others. This will help her business to be more profitable.

Her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved thanks to the loan given by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, beans, rice, and salt, among other items, as well as baby clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, and overalls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different types of shoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 44 años de edad, esta separado de su esposa y tiene un hijo. Desde hace 25 años trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería.  Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a treinta minutos en autobús y otros veinte caminando a pie con los productos que adquirió. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y para la ganadería. De esta manera, cultivara más cantidad de terreno y comprara más ganado. Su propósito es obtener mejores ingresos para financiar el estudio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Jaime is 44 years old. He is separated from his wife and has one son. For 25 years, he has been a farmer and raised cattle. He buys agricultural supplies in a city that is thirty minutes by bus and another twenty on foot with the products he bought.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy seed, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, and herbicide, and for cattle. In this way, he will cultivate a larger amount of land and buy more cattle. His goal is to earn more income to finance his son's studies.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, and herbicide, and for cattle

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old. She lives in a small village of Kaspi District, with her parents-in-law, who are provided with a retirement pension. Marina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Marina works as a cooker, at a local poultry factory. The job pays totally 300 Laris per month. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Now, Marina has requested a loan from Credo, to start up a family business. Marina has been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With this credit, Marina will purchase two milking cows. After purchasing milking cows, she will produce cheese products and sell them at local markets. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows

loans.name: Grupo Santiaguito Group

texts.es: El grupo esta conformado por solo dos personas, el nombre de su grupo lo eligieron porque así se llama el lugar donde viven. Doña Filo, como la conocen en su comunidad, es la representante, ella tiene 64 años de edad es casada con el señor Leonardo, desde hace 42 años formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cuales ya solo un hijo depende de ellos. Doña Filo se dedica a la crianza de animales como borregos y bueyes desde hace 12 años cuenta que inicio con la crianza de sus animalitos por necesidad "Todos mis hijos estudiaban y el sueldo de mi esposo no alcanzaba para solventar todos los gastos de educación y hogar fue como me vi obligada a iniciar con la actividad con la crianza de sus animalitos y gracias a eso mis hijos pudieron terminar la preparatoria" Esta solicitando el crédito para comprar mas borregos, alimento y pastura para sus borreguito que tiene en su casa y los que comprara. La señora Filo comenta que una de sus dificultades es la falta de un buen corral para poner ahí sus bueyes porque ya se acercan la temporada de lluvias y asi pueden enfermar y morir. Doña Filo tiene que hacer un gran esfuerzo para poder criarlos y crecerlos hasta grandes porque comprar el alimento no es nada fácil. Sin embargo a todas sus dificultades quiere llegar a tener muchos animales para poder seguir ayudando a su hijo con sus estudios la señora Filo comento "No me gustaría que mi hijo tuviera que dejar la escuela por falta de dinero me gustaría verlo realizado profesionalmente" Daniel es el otro integrante del grupo comenta que esta solicitando el crédito para comprar mas borregos para cría y venta.
texts.en: This group is made up of just two people. The name of the group was chosen because it is the name where they live.  Mrs. Filo, as she is known in the community, is the representative.  She is 64 years old and is married to Leonardo.  They began their family 42 years ago and have seven children of whom only one still remains a dependent.  Mrs. Filo works raising animals like yearling sheep and goats.  She began raising small animals out of necessity 12 years ago: "All of my children were studying and the salary of my husband was not enough to support all the educational and household expenses and thus I felt obligated to begin work with the raising of small animals and thanks to that my children were able to finish high school."  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more sheep, feed and grass for the sheep that she currently has and for those that she will buy.  Mrs. Filo comments that one of her challenges is the lack of a good corral where she can keep her goats since the rainy season is approaching and they can get sick and die.  Mrs. Filo has to make a great effort to raise and fatten her animals because buying the feed is not easy.  However, despite all these difficulties she wants to eventually have more animals in order to continue helping her son with his studies.  Filo comments: "I don't want my son to have to leave school due to a lack of money.  I would like to see him succeed professionally."  Daniel is the other group member and he comments that he is asking for a loan in order to buy more sheep to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy yearling sheep, corn and feed.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is a farmer in the remote village of Bubare in Mbarara district, married with five children, all in school. He started farming at the early age of 12 as it was the main economic activity in his village. After the death of his father when he was 20 years old, he struggled a lot to help his mother survive through cattle farming until he managed to start his own family, which has made him even more keen to start constructing a semi-permanent house to accommodate him and his family members. He is requesting 3,000,000 shillings to put shutters on his house and complete it. He will be using proceeds from the farm to service the requested loan.

loans.use: To buy shutters

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Vizcochoni Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” en la comunidad de Vizcochoni. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros. 

Aquelina tiene 44 años de edad y es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella vive en la comunidad de Vizcochoni a 20 minutos de la capital del distrito de Huancarani, ella se dedica a la agricultura,  a la venta de comida, a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, ella desde hace varios años que participa en el banco comunal y en esta oportunidad Aquelina requiere el préstamo para comprar por mayor sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar pues se sale más barato. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

(La comunidad de Vizcochoni está ubicado en el del distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” in the community of Vizcochoni. This Communal Bank consists of several people who look at each moment as an opportunity to move forward. Through their daily efforts, they have been able to provide a better future for their children. The members engage in businesses such as agriculture, selling food, selling groceries, fattening cattle, making handicrafts, raising livestock, raising small animals, and other trades.

Aquelina, age 44, is a friendly and responsible person who has been able to move her family forward. She lives in the community of Vizcochoni, which is 20 minutes from the capital of the District of Huancarani. She engages in farming, selling food, and selling basic necessity products. Aquelina has been a member of her Communal Bank for many years and is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy sacks of rice and sugar in bulk since the prices are cheaper.

In general, the members are appreciative of the opportunity they have received and promise to complete their loan payments according to the established terms. The community of Vizcochoni is located in the District of Colquepata, which is in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 45 years old and married, with four children. She sells general stock in Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to take care of the home.

Abibatu has been in this business since 2008 in which she sells soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem with her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Abibatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago que la Institución brinda y porque necesita capital de trabajo;  este le ayudara a comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, semilla de maíz para generar el cultivo.
El crédito anterior tuvo un efecto regular, ya que no logro sacar la cosecha que espera; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que incremento la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Blanca decided to request a new loan because PADECOMSM provides an easy payment process. She is also in need of operating capital. The loan will help her to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and corn seeds so that she can generate a crop.

The previous loan had a regular effect since she did not achieve the harvest that she had hoped. Her financial condition improved since she was able to increase her tortilla sales.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and corn seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes, eyeshadow, nail polish, eyeliner, makeup, and lipstick

loans.name: San Judas Ahorros Group

texts.es:
Ana Guadalupe tiene la edad de 35 años, solo estudio la primaria y es madre soltera de una pequeña, ella platica que como no tuvo muchos estudios desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para salir adelante, pero hace un poco mas de 3 años con el apoyo de su familia a puesto un negocio de venta de refrescos el cual con el tiempo ha crecido y ha metido mas variedad de refrescos, dulces y un poco de abarrotes, ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que está progresando. Ademas los fines de semana realiza ventas de hot-dog y hamburguesas para tener un ingreso extra, lo que mas le gusta de su actividad es que trata con personas todo el día y siempre vende, aunque sea un poco.
Un crédito de Visionfund le ayudara a comprar variedad de refrescos, jugos, frituras, dulces, jabón, arroz, leche, frijol, sopa y productos enlatados para continuar con sus ventas.

Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continué prosperando ya que quiere que en un futuro  su hija tenga oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional. 
Ella pertenece aun grupo llamado San Judas el cual esta integrado por 4 personas emprendedoras cada una de ellas con una actividad económica, ellos decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que se acostumbra que el santo de los comerciantes es San Judas Tadeo.
El grupo San Judas agradece a VisionFund el apoyo que le brindan a través de estos créditos.
los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Clarissa venta de antojitos, 
Martha  venta de refrrescos, 
Nicolas venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe, 35, only attended primary school; she’s a single mother of a little girl.  She relates that since she didn't have much formal education her parents taught her when she was very young to work in order to get ahead.  A little more than three years ago, though, with help from her family she opened a business selling refreshments that has grown in time.  She’s added a variety of soft-drinks, candy and some groceries to it.  She’s very happy with her business because it’s making progress.  

In addition, on weekends she makes hot-dogs and hamburgers to sell in order to earn extra income.  What she likes best about her activity is that she relates to people all day and always sells even if just a little.  A VisionFund loan will help her buy a variety of soft-drinks, juices, snacks, candy, soap, rice, milk, beans, soup and canned goods to continue with her sales.  She hopes with this investment that her business will continue progressing because she wants her daughter to have the opportunity of a professional career in future.

She belongs to a group called “San Judas” (St. Jude) that has four enterprising members.  Each one of them has an economic activity and they decided on this group name because tradition holds that St. Jude Thaddeus is the patron saint of merchants.  The San Judas group thanks VisionFund for the support it provides by means of these loans.

The other group members are:

Clarissa - snacks sales, 
Martha - refreshment sales, 
Nicolas - refreshment sales.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Berenice en su tienda pues invirtió en productos que tienen mayor rotación y logró incrementar sus ventas, al tener un más apropiado surtido. Sus clientes están más satisfechos, porque encuentran todo en un mismo lugar. Ella desea “para los financiadores y sus familias muchas bendiciones y especialmente salud y prosperidad.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará víveres en general como arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel, desodorantes y productos perecederos como frutas y verduras. Su inversión será exitosa porque la clientela se encuentra muy acreditada y esto hace  que su inversión tenga un retorno efectivo.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Berenice with her store because she invested in products that rotate more quickly and managed to increase her sales by having an appropriate stock on-hand.  Her customers are more satisfied because they find everything in one place.  Her wish for lenders and their families is that they have many blessings, especially good health and prosperity.

She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan by means of which she’ll buy groceries in general like rice, oil, sugar, paper, deodorants and perishables like fruit and vegetables.  Her investment will be successful because her clientele is quite distinguished which leads to her investment having an effective return.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Memunatu who is in her late forties. She is from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and the mother of 3 children between ages 7 and 22 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Memunatu runs a cookery business at home. She sells rice and pure water. She has been running this business since 2009. She works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. Memunatu says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes when the food does not finish and she runs a loss.

Memunatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items such as rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir, reside en Cartagena, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos en edades entre 26 y 30 años. Toda la familia contribuye al sostenimiento del hogar. Ella aprendió este oficio de su abuela, desde hace 17 años, y vende sus servicios de costura a vecinos, amigos y familiares. Proyecta con su segundo credikiva invertir en telas, hilos, botones, broches, cierres, que le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio, para seguir creciendo en su negocio y en sus metas a nivel familiar.
texts.en: Maribel works making clothes.  She lives in Cartagena is married and has three children whose ages range between 26 and 30 years.  The entire family contributes to household support.  She learned her occupation from her grandmother and for the last 17 years has been selling sewing services to neighbors, friends and family members.  She intends to use her second Kiva loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, clasps and zippers that will make it possible for her to provide better service to continue growing in her business and with her family goals.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las amigas  está en su Décimo Noveno ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas, gracias al trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa están creciendo y mejorando, también les ayuda las capacitaciones que están recibiendo.
Mirian es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpiezas que hacen por medio de las microfranquicias de producto de limpieza que la fundación paraguaya les ofrece como opción de negocio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, ya que así podrá invertir en su negocio y seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The group called Las Amigas (The Friends) is in its nineteenth cycle of the communal bank program. Thanks to continuous work and application of the habits essential for successful women, they are growing and improving. The trainings they are receiving are also helping them.

Mirian is one of these women. She sells cleaning products that she makes through the cleaning product microfranchises that Fundación Paraguaya offers them as a business option. She is a very hard-working person who strives.

She is asking for this loan to buy a cleaning microfranchise, since in this way she will be able to invest in her business and continue growing as a micro-businessperson.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning microfranchise to make cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay labourers

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu is 32 years old and married with 4 children who are between the ages of 5 and 17 years. She runs a fruit business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business in order to earn her daily living.

She has been in this business since 2003 and sells mangoes, bananas and oranges within her community. She says that the main problem to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mamusu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fruit including mangoes, bananas and oranges for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit including mangoes, bananas and oranges for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie who is in her early thirties. She is from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children who are aged 10 and 13 years.

Marie runs a palm oil business within her community. She started this business to meet her daily needs. She works 10 hours a day and 7 days a week. She describes her major problems to be poor transportation and poor road networks within her area of operations. 

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale in her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her business to a provision store. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane-growing region. She has three children and has been doing farming for three years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “growing crops and rearing livestock." Her biggest challenges are diseases. Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Nyota”.

Truphena was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “Better services.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she replied, “Better services.”

Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?” Truphena replied, “Cater (to) family expenses.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Truphena owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín de 58 años de edad es propietario de una droguería desde el año 2001, aprovechando su experiencia de 10 años en esa área, pues desde muy joven sintió atracción de todo lo relacionado con la salud, por eso estudió para ser gerente de farmacia y posteriormente trabajó mucho tiempo en distintos laboratorios. Los productos que ofrece son los medicamentos que mas requieren en la comunidad objeto de su mercadeo. Joaquín trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, realiza sus compras en los laboratorios distribuidores y sus ventas las ofrece a crédito y de contado. Su sueño de prosperidad es convertir su droguería en una gran distribuidora de medicamentos dirigida a los barrios del municipio y  a nivel personal brindarle aumentar la calidad de vida a su familia. En la actualidad Joaquín está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará medicinas para atender las necesidades primarias de sus clientes. Con su credikiva logrará aumentar su capital de trabajo y manejar un inventario más acorde con la rotación de los medicamentos.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 58 years old and has been the owner of a drugstore since 2001, taking advantage of his 10 years of experience in this area. From a very young age, he has been attracted to everything related to health. For this reason, Joaquín studied to become a pharmacy manager and later worked for a long time at different laboratories. The products that he offers are medicines most requested in the community as a result of his marketing. Joaquín works Monday through Sunday from 9:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. He purchases his goods from the laboratory distributors and then sells them on credit or for cash. His dream of prosperity is to convert his drugstore into a large pharmaceutical distribution center directed at the neighborhoods in his town. On a personal level, he would like to improve the quality of life for his family.

Joaquín is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This will enable him to buy medicines so that he can meet the primary needs of his customers. His Kiva loan will increase his operating capital so that he can manage his inventory based on the turnover of the medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, pesticides and pay for labour.

loans.name: Marekhi

texts.en:
Marekhi is 26 years old. She lives in the small village of Chiatura District with her husband and father-in-law. Marekhi had requested for a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time due to her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow and a pig. Marekhi milks the cow and produces cheese products. While they sell cheese and piglets at a good price, it is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marekhi had requested for a loan from Credo to start a family business and has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Marekhi will begin trading in clothes. She plans to purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then resell at higher prices. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Feremusu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Feremusu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children, 3 years old and 10 years old.

Feremusu runs a medicine business; she sells pain tablets, oral rehydration salts, choral drugs and blood syrup within her community. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week.  She says the major problem to her business is that sometimes sales are very slow. 

Feremusu has requested a loan in order to buy more medical drugs such as pain tablets, oral rehydration salts, choral drugs and blood syrup for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a pharmacy. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more medical drugs such as pain tablets, oral rehydration salts, choral drugs and blood syrup for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza  está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien a través de su esfuerzo y el trabajo arduo está mejorando su situación pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total.
Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles y de productos de limpieza que ella compra en forma de microfranquicias que la fundación paraguaya les ofrece. Ella cuenta que lucha por poder crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, para que de esa forma su negocio vaya mejorando y a su familia no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The group called “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) is in cycle #7 in the women’s committee program.  One of its members is María who by means of her efforts and hard work is improving her situation.  At the same time, she’s aware that this work and effort she’s making must be continuous and permanent in order to reach total success.

María sells foodstuffs and cleaning supplies that she buys as mini-franchises that Fundación Paraguaya offers.  She relates that she strives to be able to grow and help her family.

She’s requesting this loan to buy cleaning supplies mini-franchises so that her business will continue improving and so that her family will have no unmet needs.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies mini-franchises.

loans.name: Maqsud

texts.ru: Максуду 26 лет. Он женат и у него двое сыновей. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Спитамен. Жена Максуда работает портнихой, она у себя на дому занимается вышиванием женских национальных платьев. Сам Максуд работает на стройке, у него есть бригада работников, и они строят дома на заказ. Максуд трудолюбивый и предприимчивый человек. Одновременно он намерен начать новый бизнес и заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. При дворе дома у него построен сарай для содержания скота. Максуд запрашивает кредит для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота. Данный кредит поможет Максуду начать новый бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Maqsud is 26 years old, married and has two sons. He lives with his family in Spitamen region. Maqsud's wife is a seamstress and sews national Tajik dresses to order from home. Maqsud himself works in construction, he has his own team of construction workers and builds custom houses. But Maqsud is hard working and energetic so he wants to start another business and sell cattle. His house has a livestock barn in the backyard. Maqsud is requesting a loan to purchase two cows to start his business. This loan will allow him to improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos; este le permitirá comprar más cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos.
El efecto del  crédito anterior fue notable, ya que le ayudo a crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que las utilidades han incrementado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Idalia needs more working capital to continue her business and thus earn more income. This will allow her to buy more pigs and feed to fatten them.

The previous loan had a notable effect, since it helped her to grow and to have everything necessary in order to work. The economic conditions have improved, since the profits have increased, and the family circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed to fatten them

loans.name: Nasibjon

texts.ru:
Насибчон родился 1974 году. После окончании школы он поступил в местный техникум, и параллельно работал продавцом а магазине хоз.товаров. После окончания колледжа он сам начал самостоятельно работать. Более трех лет занимался  этим видом бизнеса. Женат имеет двоих детей. Его жена занята дома воспитанием детей и  еще она ухаживает за свекровью. Она старая и не может самостоятельно даже ходить. 
 Насибчон  сейчас занимается производством деревянных  окон и дверей.  Он покупает доски с базара другого города и сам производит качественные окна и двери. Он имеет очень много клиентов.  У него очень хороший бизнес, и день за днем он расширяется. Сейчас он нуждается в денежных средствах, чтобы приобрести доски. Насибчон решил подать заявку на кредит и обратился в организацию Арванд. Надеется,что ему в Арванде  помогут и поддержат.
texts.en: Nasibjon was born in 1974. After finishing high school he attended the local technical college and also worked as a salesman in a housewares store. After finishing college he started to work for himself and has had his woodworking business for three years now. Nasibjon is married and has two children. His wife is raising the children at home and she also takes care of her mother-in-law, who is old and can't even walk on her own. Nasibjon himself makes wooden windows and doors in his workshop. He purchases lumber at the market of another town and makes everything himself. He has many good clients. The business is good and expanding every day. Now Nasibjon needs financial assistance to that he can purchase a big batch of lumber. He has turned to Arvand for a loan and is hoping that Arvand will offer him support.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, buttons, clasps, and zippers to make uniforms for students and softball teams.

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Mirian, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, ella y su familia vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace 10 años que se dedica a vender frutas como sandias, manzanas, uvas, mangos, bananos etc. papas y otras verduras. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa dedicándole todo el tiempo necesario ya que es su fuente de ingresos familiar. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más frutas frescas de la temporada para vender. Su plan es seguir manteniendo su negocio y que crezca cada dia mas para un bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mirian is 38 years old and married. She has five children and lives with her family in the town of Puerto Cortes. She has always worked as a vendor. She has been selling fruit like watermelon, apples, grapes, mangos, bananas, etc. and potatoes and other vegetables for ten years. She runs her business at home and dedicates as much time as is necessary to it, because it is her family's source of income.

The loan she is requesting is for 6,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy more seasonal fresh fruit to sell. Her plan is to keep her business going and expand it day by day for her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Умарали жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 40  лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Умарали со своей семьёй живёт в маленьком горном посёлке. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание, он со своей женой ведут свой бизнес. Они очень хотят развивать этот бизнес для получения хорошей прибыли. А также они копят деньги на строительство большого дома, где будут жить их дети со своими семьями. Умарали занимается животноводством, он покупает скот, выращивает их и потом продаёт мясо  и полученное от них молоко. От этого вида бизнеса он получает хороший доход для проживания и удовлетворения потребностей  и нужд своей семьи. Жена Умарали помогает ему в этом деле, на неё возложена ответственность ухаживать за скотом, а также по утрам она продаёт молоко, полученное от этого скота. Умарали пасёт своих скот на поле неподалёку от своего дома. А также он ухаживает за скотом своих друзей и знакомых в горных регионах и за это они платят ему деньги. Сейчас Умарали планирует увеличить количество своего скота в целях увеличения своего бизнеса и получения больше прибыли. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для того, чтобы купить некоторое количество голов скота. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Umarali is an optimistic 40 year old man. He is married and has three children. Umarali lives with his family in a small mountain village. To earn money he and his wife have their own business. They really want to expand it so that they will have more money for living. They are also saving money to build a bigger house where their children can live with their own families. Umarali raises cattle for a living and sells their meat and milk. The livestock business provides the family with a comfortable income and takes care of his family's needs. Umarali's wife helps take care of the animals and she also sells milk in the morning to her neighbors. Umarali pastures the cattle near his house. He also takes care of the neighbors' and friends' livestock in the mountains and they pay him for the service. Now Umarali plans to expand his herd so that more profits can be made from it. He has turned to Arvand for a loan which he will use to buy more cattle. Umarali is thankful in advance to Arvand for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en el negocio de venta de tortillas, cosméticos y lociones; este le ayudara a comprar maíz, leña, gas, cremas, esmaltes,  lociones, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado apoyar a su familia; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo.
texts.en:
Catalina needs to take out another loan because she needs more working capital to continue her business selling tortillas, cosmetics, and lotions. This will help her to buy corn, firewood, gas, creams, nail polish, and lotions, among other items.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen the business, and with the earnings she has succeeded in supporting her family. The financial conditions have improved and the family circumstances have as well.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas, creams, nail polish, and lotions, among other items

loans.name: Claudia Rosa

texts.es: Claudia de 36 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de flores, accesorios para cabezas como binchas y ganchos artesanales; Claudia  vive en Cartagena, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en edad de 6 a 17 años. Desde hace 3 años inició su negocio y hasta hoy aun no se ha detenido,  vendiendo a crédito sus productos en misceláneas y amigas que le refieren nuevos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertir en la compra de insumos como fomi, pegante, tijeras y cintas para la elaboración de sus productos, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, pues su sueño de prosperidad es mas adelante tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Claudia, 36, works making and selling flowers and artisanal hair accessories like bands and hooks.  Claudia lives in Cartagena with her spouse and two children aged 6 and 17.  She started her business three years ago and hasn’t stopped to date.  She sells on credit to novelty shops and to girlfriends who refer other customers to her.

She’s currently applying for her first Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy supplies like foam rubber, glue, scissors and tape to make her products in order to increase sales and improve income because her dream of  future prosperity is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen de 22 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de tallado de piedras; ella reside con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos menores de edad, en San Juan  Nepomuceno, (población del departamento de Bolívar, de amplias tradiciones artesanales). Aprendió este oficio de su conyugue, quien conoció el arte plasmado en piedras, en la ciudad de Santa Marta y luego lo trajo a San Juan Nepomuceno donde lo perfeccionó y lo convirtió en su alternativa  generadora  de ingresos para resolver las necesidades de sostenimiento y bienestar en su hogar. En la actualidad Karen trabaja en este mismo arte para apoyar la gestión de su cónyuge y se encuentre aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertirlo en la compra de su materia prima principal, que es la piedra talco, la cual debe traer de una población lejana. 
Su meta más adelante, es ubicar un punto de ventas en la ciudad de Cartagena; su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente dinero, para hacer una compra en un mayor volumen y disminuir los gastos que genera el traer la metería primas desde lejos. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rentabilidad no menor a un 15% desde el cual proyecta su inversión de credikiva, y planea su éxito.
texts.en:
Karen, 22, works carving stone.  She lives with her spouse and two minor children in San Juan Nepomuceno (a town in Bolívar Department with extensive artisanal traditions).  She learned this occupation from her spouse who learned the art of carving stone in the city of Santa Marta and then brought it to San Juan Nepomuceno where he perfected it and turned it into his alternate way of earning income to cover household expenses and provide well-being at home.  Currently, Karen works in this same art to help out her spouse.  She’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy her main raw material, soapstone, which must be brought from a distant town.

Her goal for later on is to open a sales point in the city of Cartagena.  Her greatest challenge is having enough money to make a high volume purchase thus reducing transportation costs associated with bringing the raw material from so far away.  While this occurs, she has a profit margin of no less than 15% from which she projects her Kiva loan’s investment and plans her success.

loans.use: to buy soapstone in large amounts.

loans.name: Olfa Josefina

texts.es:
OLFA tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos en el Cantón Chimbo.

Olfa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Solicita el credito para comprar herbicidas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, urea. Con la ayuda del credito podra comprar los materiales necesario para la agricultura.

El sueño es incrementar el cultivo y mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia. Los desafios  a los que se enfrenta es poder dar la educaci{on a todos los hijos. 

En el tiempo lire le gusta salir a pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Olfa is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in Chimbo canton.

She is a farmer and grows corn and beans. She is asking for the loan to buy herbicide, fertilizer, insecticide, and urea. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the materials necessary for farming.

Her dream is to increase the crops and improve her family's quality of life. The challenge she faces is being able to give all of her children an education.

In her free time she likes to go out for a walk with the children.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, fertilizer, insecticides, and urea

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton de 45 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de rejas, puertas y canastas para ventanas en hierro y aluminio.
