Él habita Vive en San Juan de Nepomuceno, con su conyugue y 2 hijos en edad de 16 y 17 años y desde hace 15 años aprendió este oficio en Venezuela, país fronterizo,  y en Colombia emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, el cual poco a poco ha logrado sacar adelante, con una clientela conformada por colegios y la comunidad del municipio donde habita, vendiéndoles sus productos directamente, de  buena calidad, a la medida de su clientela y  en las modalidad, crédito y contado. Milton trabaja diariamente desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, para generar las expectativas de ingresos que necesita para responder a su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertirlo en la compra de hierro y aluminio, para atender los pedidos que tiene de su clientela, y así seguir mejorando en el negocio, pues tienen como metas mas adelante perfeccionar la infraestructura técnica de su taller, con maquinarias de corte y dobladora.
texts.en:
Milton, 45, makes iron and aluminum grills, doors, and window frames. He lives in San Juan de Nepomuceno with his wife and two children, ages 16 and 17. He learned this trade 15 years ago in neighboring Venezuela and in Colombia. He started his own business, which he has managed to grow steadily with customers from schools and the local community. He sells his quality merchandise directly to these customers by order and for cash and credit.  

Milton works every day from 7 AM until 6 PM to earn the money he needs to support his family. He has applied for his Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy iron and aluminum to fill customer orders and keep growing his business. His long-term goal is to upgrade his workshop's infrastructure by buying cutting and bending machinery.

loans.use: to buy iron and aluminum.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de 32 años que vive en Paraíso de Pocosol, es casada y tiene una hija, desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a producir queso de muy buena calidad, oficio que aprendió desde pequeña con su madre y actualmente lo ejerce con su esposo el cual se dedica a la misma actividad, viajan todos los días en una moto a su lugar de trabajo ubicado a 1 km de su casa de habitación.

Este negocio hace sentir a Rosalia muy orgullosa y con una gran satisfacción personal, ya que es un trabajo propio y con los ingresos que recibe gracias a esta actividad; puede cubrir junto con su esposo las necesidades que se les presenta diariamente a ellos y a su hija.

Ella desea obtener este crédito para comprar 2 terneras, ya que con la compra de estos animales  espera aumentar en un 30% su producción de leche y queso.

En este momento ella le vende el producto a un cliente, que se encarga de distribuirlo, pero Rosalia confía que con el dinero de este crédito pueda ponerle nombre a su producto y venderlo directamente a clientes de la comunidad y lugares cercanos.

Ella espera aumentar sus ganancias para satisfacer tanto las necesidades de su familia como las de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Paraíso in Pocosol. She is married and has a daughter. For ten years she has made a living making very good quality cheese. She learned the business as a small girl with her mother and she currently does it with her husband who is also in the business. They travel every day on a motorcycle to their place of work located 1 km from their home. 

The business makes Rosalia feel very proud and gives her great personal satisfaction as it is her own business. With the income she receives, thanks to the business, she and her husband are able to cover the daily necessities that come up daily for them and her daughter.

She wants to get this loan to buy two calves because with the purchase of these animal she hopes to increase her milk and cheese production by 30 percent. Right now she sells her product to a customer who then distributes it, but Rosalia confides that with the money from this loan she can put her name on her product and sell it directly to customers in the community and in nearby places.

She hopes to increase her profits to ensure the necessities of her family as well as her customers.

loans.use: to buy two calves and improve the quality of her products.

loans.name: Sabba

texts.en: Sabba is 53 years old and she lives with her parents. The source of income of their family is her father's pension and her animal husbandry activity. She sells milk and milk products. She also buys cattle, fattens them for some months, and then sells them on the livestock market at a profit. She is planning to use the land that her family owns and, in parallel with agriculture, to start an agronomy business. Sabba has a good place for the cattle and a little building in the yard of house, but it needs repair. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALFA Y OMEGA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Tereza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzados, elaboración de caretas de estuco, tienda de barrio, taller de costura, venta de café, venta de salchipapa, tejido de chompas, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Tereza es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años y lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las el área de salud, capacitaciones y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank Alfa Y Omega is starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer. It belongs to the regional office of Senkata and comprises nine female members. Tereza is the President of their board of directors. The businesses run by the members of this communal bank are varied. They include selling shoes, making plaster masks, a neighborhood store, a sewing shop, selling coffee, selling sausages and potatoes, weaving sweaters, and selling fruit.

The loan they are requesting will benefit this group of small businesswomen of which Tereza is a member. She says she has belonged to Pro Mujer for three cycles and enrolled through her friend's invitation, who was already a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling shoes. She says she learned this business several years ago and started it with her husband. 
 
The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (purchase shoes) which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell the product in her business space. Working this way allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has three children. 
 
When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she replies that what she likes the most is the healthcare, the trainings, and the lending.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Amistosas De Cascada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMISTOSAS DE LA CASCADA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verdura, tejido de chompas, trenzado de mantas, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que necesitaba generar recursos y conocía la técnica de tejido, decide realizar este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Amistosas de la Cascada" (Friendly Women of the Cascade) communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascade regional office. It is made up of six members and is directed by a board, of which Luisa is the President. The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses. Among them are selling vegetables, knitting sweaters, weaving blankets, and making polleras (traditional skirts).

The loan that they will receive will benefit small micro-businesswomen. Luisa is one of them. She indicates that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her friend who is part of the institution. Currently she has a business knitting sweaters. She says that she learned this business on her own initiative. Since she needed to generate resources and knew how to knit, she decided to start this business.

The loan she will now receive is for increasing working capital (buying wool) that she will obtain wholesale from businesses in the city of El Alto. After production she will sell them in her booth. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she is married and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Joel David

texts.es: El joven Joel, de 23 años de edad estudiante de la carrera de Licenciatura en Desarrollo Rural, en la actualidad no está trabajando solamente se dedica a sus estudios que gracias a una beca lo está cursando, el crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora para poder hacer su tesis de la profesión, es muy importante para el adquirir este quipo tan indispensable para hacer investigaciones y avanzar mejor en sus estudios.
texts.en: Joel, 23, is studying Rural Development in college. He is not working and can devote all his time to studying, thanks to the scholarship he received. He has applied for a loan to buy a computer so that he can complete his thesis. Acquiring a computer is very important to him because it is essential for doing research and making progress in his studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Abibatu, from Tombo in rural western Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 12 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Abibatu established her plastic rubber business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income to support her home. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes the bowls break on the way to her.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Abibatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
Sento is in her late 30s and married with 3 children who are between 9 and 20 years old. She runs a plastic rubber business in Tombo in the Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells plastic food containers, buckets and bowls within her community. She says that the main challenges to her business are her improper business location and inadequate funds to expand her business.

Sento requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic food containers, buckets and bowls. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to build a house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic food containers, buckets and bowls to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Betty from Tombo, in a Western rural area of Freetown. She is married with two children, ages five and eight. Both of her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Betty established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run it.

Betty requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Betty plans to expand the business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Elidio

texts.es: Elidio, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casado, vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Elidio, 57, is married living with his wife who is his greatest priority.  He intends to use his loan to buy fertilizer and fungicide and to pay labor costs to do the chores in his coffee crop; he will also buy some seedlings to replant at the beginning of the rainy season to increase area plant density to take advantage of the soil’s high fertility and the weather conditions that are favorable for coffee growing.  With these crop improvements he hopes to net a bit of profit thus improving his family’s living conditions and also to invest a bit more into his planted area and reach some goals.  This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans from state banks and Fudecosur has provided the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 57 years old, lives in Teshie, a town in Ghana's capital city of Accra. Mary has been selling silver products and fish for ten years. She is a widow and has three grown children. Mary buys silver products from the factory and fish from the fishing harbor. She is requesting a loan of 2000 Ghanian Cedis (GHS) to purchase more fish and silver products (cooking and washing utensils).

Mary is doing this job to help finance her children's education. She is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: To buy silver products from the factory and fish from the fishing harbor.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is in her late twenties and married with two children, ages four and ten years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, in a Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to finance her daily living.

She's been in this business since 2007 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well, and out of the profits, she was able to take care of her parents.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and acquire a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to become a successful businesswoman. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS DE GUADALUPE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nivia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de cotillones, venta de postres y plátanos, venta de rellenos, venta de verdura y papa, venta de chicharrón.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nivia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de cotillones; mismo que inicia con el apoyo de su madre hace más de diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra esponja) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y las capacitaciones
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Rosas De Guadalupe is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer. It belongs to the regional office of Santiago II and comprises six members. Niva is the President of their board of directors. The businesses run by the members of this communal bank are varied. They include making decorations, selling desserts and plantains, selling filling, selling vegetables and potatoes, and selling pork rinds. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit this group of small businesswomen, of which Nivia is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer six months ago through an adviser of the institution who went to see her at her house and invited her. She currently has a business selling party decorations, which she started with her mother's help over ten years ago.
 
The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase capital. She will purchase foam from the markets in the city of El Alto in order to make decorations and then sell them in her place of business. Working this way allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the loans and the trainings.

loans.use: to purchase foam.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy CDs.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 53 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar, está casado con Juana quien es madre de sus hijos de 18 y 14 años, vive en compañía de sus hijos, habitando su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Jesús es el cultivo de de yucas y plátanos  para la venta en los mercados de su localidad y para su consumo personal,  además de tener sembríos de palma aceitera contando para eso con un terreno de 20 hectáreas  que lo adquirió hace 30 años, tiempo que viene ejerciendo este oficio.
Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que lleva muchos años dedicándose a ese oficio, y dicha experiencia la está pasando a sus hijos, además de las ganancias que le deja con la cual a sabido mantener a su familiar y procurar que no les falte lo necesario .Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para la producción de palma así como el pago de personal para la cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 53 years old and he is a hard working, as well as a persevering man, with a will to succeed. He is married to his wife Juana, who is the mother of his children who are 18 and 14 years old. He lives with his children in their own home. Jesús is involved in the cultivation of yuccas and plantains to sell at his local markets and also for his own person consumption. He also has oil palm seedlings and has 20 hectares to dedicate to his agricultural activity, that he acquired 30 years ago, when he began this economic activity. 

He likes his business because he knows it well as he has been involved in the field for many years. His experience is also being passed down to his children, as well as the earnings that he is left with after he takes care of this family and makes sure that they are not lacking in anything. This will be his second loan with Kiva, and so he is counting on his collaboration with this organization in order to achieve his objectives. With the amount he is asking for, he will purchase organic fertilizer in order to grow the palm and also to pay for labor when it is time to harvest his products.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARANATHA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Balvina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de sal, venta de fruta, venta de verduras, venta de regalos, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Balvina es integrante, ella indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salteñas (comida de media mañana); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de salteñas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el grupo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Maranatha” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Balvina.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of business among which are sweater knitting, food sales, salt sales, fruit sales, vegetable sales, gift sales and jacket sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro-business women like Balvina.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for twelve years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who’s a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling turnovers (mid-morning meal).  She makes it known that she learned the business several years ago on her own initiative.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy turnovers from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then resell them from place to place.  This way of working makes it possible for her to earn resources needed to support her family since she’s in a common law relationship and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the work group.

loans.use: to buy turnovers.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Salamatu from Tombo, in the western rural area near Freetown. She is in her early forties and married, and she is blessed with three children between the ages four and twelve years. Two of her children attend school. 

Salamatu runs an arts business, where she makes and sells clothing within her community. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Salamatu says that the main challenge to her business is her lack of finances.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to change her business and buy palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to change her business by buying palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes to resell and to repair their house roof.

loans.name: Idelfonso

texts.es: Idelfonso, de 39 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, esta casado y tiene 5 hijos de 22, 21, 20, 16  y 06 años de edad respectivamente, vive en compañía de sus  hijos en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Idelfonso es la agricultura específicamente al sembrío de palma aceitera, pues lo ha visto como un negocio sumadamente rentable, para eso cuenta con un terreno de 20 hectáreas de las cuales 06 hectáreas las tiene en producción, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 03 años, gracias al incentivo del gobierno regional quien les proporcionó las semillas, además del apoyo de sus hijos en las labores de mantenimiento de las parcelas.Le gusta esta actividad por que ha visto que le resulta bastante rentable pues tiene un buen precio en le mercado de su ciudad, logrando obtener buenas ganancias  con las cuales paga el personal que emplea en la cosecha, además de sus gastos familiares.Este será el segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo . Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles contratará personal para el proceso de cosecha de sus parcelas de palma aceitera.
texts.en: Ildefonso, 39 years old, is a hard-working man with a lot of desire to move ahead and make progress. He is married and has 5 children aged 6, 16, 20, 21, and 22 years. He lives with his children in his own house. Ildefonso is a farmer; specifically, he grows oil palms, since he has seen it to be an extremely profitable business. For this purpose he has 20 hectares of land, of which he has 6 hectares in production. He has been doing this work for 3 years, thanks to the incentives of the regional government, which gave them the seeds, as well as the help of his children with the maintenance work on the parcels. He likes this work because he has seen that it is pretty profitable for him. It brings a good price in the market in his city, and he is able to make a good profit, with which he pays the workers he employs during the harvest, as well as his family expenses. This will be the second loan with Kiva and he feels very grateful for the support, so he hopes for your cooperation so that he can fulfill his plans. With the amount requested of 2500 nuevos soles, he will hire workers for the harvest of his oil palm parcels.

loans.use: to hire workers for his land

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Maseray from Tombo, in western rural Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 17. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2003, Maseray established her soap business. She began her business because she wants to provide daily meals and move forward with her family. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that transportation is very difficult    .

Maseray requires a loan in order to buy detergent for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, Maseray plans to open a palm oil store. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy detergent for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Zainab who is in her early 40s. She is from Tombo in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married to a driver and blessed with three children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old. Two of her children attend school. 

Zainab runs a food stand business at home. She sells rice, tomato paste and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Zainab says that the main challenge to her business her price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Zainab has requested a loan to buy more cooking items like rice, tomato paste and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, tomato paste and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Aminata from Tombo in the western rural area. She is married with two children between the ages of two and five years old. Both of her children attend school. 

Aminata runs a clothing business. She sells wax (batik) cotton within her community. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week.   Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan to purchase more wax cotton for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase more wax (batik) cotton for resale

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa , está divorciada del  padre de sus hijos y vive con sus 02 hijos de 28 y 23 años de edad en su casa propia .La actividad que realiza Bertha es la venta de comidas rápidas como salchipollos, pollos brosters y alitas fritas, además de tener una tienda de productos comestibles.Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que en el pasado sufrió un accidente que le imposibilitó trabajar en una empresa y cuando se recuperó viendo la necesidad de tener un oficio se decidió por iniciare en este negocio,  y viendo que le resultaba rentable se decidió continuar hasta la actualidad, ahora tendido muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio deseando abrir un restaurante en su casa.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva por lo tanto esta agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles comprará mesas y sillas, además de utensilios de cocinas como ollas, cucharas, platos para implementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s divorced from the father of her children and lives in her own house with her two children who are 28 and 23 years of age.  Bertha’s activity is selling fast-food like ‘salchipollos’ [fried potatoes with fried chicken], Broaster-style chicken and fried wings; she also has a grocery store.  She likes her work because it makes it possible for her to earn income to cover household expenses because in the past she suffered an accident that prevented her from working in a firm.  When she recovered she needed to have an occupation and she decided to start this business.  Seeing that it was profitable she decided to continue with it to date.  Now, very much wanting to continue growing and expanding the business she wants to open a restaurant at home.

This is her second Kiva loan so she’s grateful to get the financial support that will help her continue forward.  She will use the requested 600 new soles to buy tables, chairs and other cooking utensils like pots, spoons and dishes to better equip her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, de 43 años de edad, es padre soltero de un hijo adolescente con quien vive en su casa propia.Félix se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, instalando todos los días una mesa en el mercado principal de la ciudad de su distrito, de esa manera oferta sus productos a los clientes que concurren a diario a este mercado, a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial.Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productivo. Por tanto desea incrementar su mercaderia para así lograr el avance de su negocio. Además tiene planes de comprarse una unidad de transporte y alquilarlo, para generarse más ingresos económicos.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto espera de su apoyo financiero para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará diversas verduras y frutas, buscando menores precios por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Félix, 43 years old, is a single father of an adolescent son, with whom he lives in his own house. Félix sells fruit and vegetables, setting up every day on a table in the main market of the city in his district and offering his products to the customers who come to this market every day. He waits on them in a friendly and cordial way. He likes his business since it generates an income and allows him to have an occupation and feel like a productive person. Therefore, he wants to increase his merchandise in order to move his business forward. He also has plans to buy a vehicle and rent it out in order to generate more income. This will be his second loan with Kiva, so he hopes for your financial support so that he can meet his goals.

With the amount requested of 3000 nuevos soles, he will buy a variety of fruit and vegetables, looking for lower prices for his volume purchases.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace was excited about her partnership with Kiva during the previous cycle. She now wants a loan to buy a piece of land in the area neighboring the school so that she can construct a structure to house her pupils since she intends to add another classroom because of the demand for her services in the area. She thinks this will help to adequately meet the needs of the community and therefore improve the quality of her services. She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariama from Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 7 and 10.

Mariama sells fish within a busy market area. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business from morning to night, throughout the week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to run her business.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like fish and palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she want to open a food shop and stop walking. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like fish and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Litoral De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LITORAL DE SENKATA”  iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, venta de ropa usada, venta de medicamento, venta de dulces, producción de deportivos, venta de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de carpintería en el domicilio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su hermano y posterior a su matrimonio decide, conjuntamente su esposo, implementar un taller en su domicilio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las transportadoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la Ciudad de Oruro a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Litoral de Senkata" communal bank will start its 27th loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of nine members, and led by a board of directors of which Celia is the chair. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied and include: carpentry workshop, selling used clothing, selling medicines, selling candy, making sportswear, and selling chicken.

The loan they will take out is to benefit small business owners such as Celia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 11 years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. 

Currently she has a carpentry workshop in her home. The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital by purchasing wood, which she will acquire from the wholesale shippers in the city of La Paz. After the items are made, she will sell them in the city of Oruro, based on orders. 

This work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training workshops and the loans.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Ruth Evelina

texts.es: Ruth, tiene 23 años es casada no tiene hijos aun, primeramente desea enfocarse en su carrera de Química y Farmacia, cursa sus estudios gracias a una media beca, ella tiene muchas ilusiones de superarse con sus estudios para ayudar a sus padres. El crédito lo solicita para comprarse una computadora, ya que muchas veces tiene que hacer tareas de investigacion de noche en los cyber café y es peligroso por la zona donde habita, es por eso que necesita en gran manera comprarse la computadora.
texts.en: Ruth, 23, is married but has no children yet; she’d like to focus first on her pharmacy and chemistry career.  She’s studying thanks to a half scholarship.  She very much wants to improve by means of her studies in order to help her parents.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy a computer because she often has to do her research at night in an Internet café and she lives in an unsafe zone; this is why she greatly needs to buy herself a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 28 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Lorena quien es ama de casa y madre de sus hijos. Juntos habitan la casa de sus padres en compañía de su papá, hermana, dos sobrinos, y su abuela.La actividad que realiza Francisco es el transporte para eso cuenta con un auto que compró con su propio capital, lleva 3 años en esta actividad.Le gusta su actividad pues le brinda los ingresos económicos y le permite tener un oficio ya que no conseguía empleo, además de poder manejar su propio tiempo y sentirse independiente. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte en la ciudad y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y crecer, deseando comprarse otra unidad de transporte y generar más ingresos económicos.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para su auto, así como el pago del servicio a un mecánico.
texts.en:
Francisco, 28, is a hardworking, enterprising man in addition to being kind and cordial.  He lives with Lorena who is a housewife and the mother of their children.  They live together in his parents’ house in the company of his father, sister, two nephews and his grandmother.

The activity Francisco does is transportation.  To do so, he bought a car with his own capital; he’s been in business three years.  He likes it because it provides him with income and employment since he hadn’t been able to find a job.  Besides, he can manage his own time and feel independent.  He considers his business to be quite profitable because transportation in the city is in demand and it produces good profits.  Because of this, he plans to expand the business and to grow.  He wants to buy another car to generate more income.

This will be his second Kiva loan so he’s hoping for your collaboration to continue towards his objectives.  He will use the requested 3,000 new soles to buy spare parts for his car as well as to pay for a mechanic’s services.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika  de 35 años de edad, se dedica a prestar servicios personales de belleza y comercializa productos capilares y de mejoramiento de la imagen. Ella inició su experiencia de negocio desde el año 2004, cuando trabajando para una empresa estatal, invertía en la compra de artículos que vendía a crédito, logrando hacer su primera clientela y  posteriormente  incursionar en otros mercados de clientes; como también estaba interesada en aprender sobre el cuidado de la imagen, estudió un curso técnico en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje. “SENA”  y allí aprendió todo lo que hoy practica en su negocio y con lo que genera ingresos. : Pedicure, manicure, peinados, tratamientos capilares etc.  Así que su día laboral inicia desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, o hasta que lo requiera su clientela, pues su meta mas adelante, es tener es una estructura de negocio físicamente más confortable, para captar la atención, el interés y del deseo de compra de su clientela y lograr incrementar sus ingresos, y ofrecer a sus tres hijos de 9 a 16 años, cada vez un mayor bienestar, tal como es su sueño de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprara productos capilares y planchas para fortalecer el servicio de peinado; su experiencia y disciplina de trabajo hará de su credikiva una inversión de mucho éxito.
texts.en: Erika, 35 years old, is dedicated to providing personal beauty service and she also sells hair and other beauty enhancement products.  She started this business in 2004, while working for a state run company.  She invested in her product inventory on credit and she earned her first customer and later clients from other markets.  She wanted to learn about the beauty and took a "SENSA" [Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje - National Service Learning course] from which she learned all that she could practice in her business to generate income, including: pedicures, manicures, hair styling, hair treatments etc. Her work day starts from 10 am to 8 pm, or as required by her customers.  Her goal later on is to have a business structure that is physically more comfortable, to attract and retain interested clientele to increase revenue.  She wants to offer her three children, ages 9 to 16 years old, a better life, this is her dream.  She will apply the loan to buy hair products and styling irons to strengthen her hair salon services. Her experience and work ethic will make her loan very successful investment.

loans.use: to buy hair products and styling irons to strengthen her hair salon services.

loans.name: J.bosco

texts.en:
J.bosco is a 38-year-old man from Kayonza District, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people in his village who do not have electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  

J.bosco started selling lights in November 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: J Berchmas

texts.en:
J Berchmas is a 35-year-old man from Rwamagana District, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten, rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people in his village who do not have electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

J Berchmas started selling lights in June 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: This is Pascal's third Kiva loan request. He is seeking an top up loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just  100 RWF. Pascal started selling lights in June, 2011, and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 36-year-old man from Rulindo District, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten, rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people in his village who do not have electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Antoine started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Alejandro Luis

texts.es:
Alejandro es casado vive en Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.


Alejandro es empleado privado trabaja como guardia de seguridad en la Coopañia Aseguros, el credito lo solicita para la compra de una lavadora y una licuadora para la casa. El credito ha sido de mucha ayuda para comprar lo que necesita de manera rapida y mas conveniente.

El sueño de Alejandro es tener buena salud y tener el trabajo para ayudar a la economia de la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la familia a caminar en el campo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is married and living in the Chimbo providence of Bolivia. Alejandro is privately employed and works as a security guard for “Coopañia Aseguros” (Security Company). The loan he is requesting is to purchase a washing machine and a blender for his home. The loan has been very helpful to purchase what he needs in a quick and convenient manner. 

Alejandro’s dream is to have good health and have a job to help the family. In his free time he likes to go walking with his family in the field.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and a blender

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad, se dedica  a la venta de mercancía en general, en el municipio de Puerto Colombia,  lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, donde habita con sus dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 25 años de edad.  Su experiencia comercial data de hace tres años, cuando su hermana de actividad comerciante desde el año 1999, le sugirió dedicarse a este oficio y solo hasta el año 2010 Maria inició y no se ha detenido. Los productos principales de su oferta, son las camisas, el calzado la perfumería, los bolsos y la línea de cosméticos, artículos que vende directamente y mediante crédito, a su clientela, con una dedicación de 12 horas diarias. Su meta mas adelante es dar apertura a un local publico y remodelar su vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es incrementar sus ventas, porque requiere una mayor inversión. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el  cual comprará jeans, camisas, masculinas, cremas calzado, perfume y bolsos. Con esta inversión aumentará su capital de trabajo y logrará mayores compras, además de fabulosos descuentos, para trasladar a su precio de venta y espera lograr el aumento de su clientela, convirtiendo su inversión en muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and sells general merchandise, in the municipality of Puerto Colombia. This is a place located on the shores of the Caribbean, where she lives with her two children, ages 21 and 25. Her business experience dates from three years ago, when her brother, who has been a merchant since 1999, suggested that she follow this occupation. She did not start until 2010, and hasn't stopped. 

The main products she sells are shirts, footwear, perfume, bags and a line of cosmetics. She sells these articles directly to her clientele and extends credit. She devotes 12 hours a day to her business. 

Her goal is to someday open a small store open to the public, and to renovate her home. But her greatest challenge is to increase her sales, because she needs to make a greater investment. This is why she is approaching the institution for a credikiva loan, her first from from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy jeans, men's shirts, creams, footwear, perfume and bags. 

With this investment she will increase her working capital and manage greater purchases, in addition to getting fabulous discounts that will be reflected in her selling prices. This will make her investment very successful.

loans.use: To buy jeans, men's shirts, creams, footwear, perfume and bags.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is a 28-year-old man from Kayonza District, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten, rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people in his village who do not have electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Theoneste started selling lights in July 2012 and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 50 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de ser alegre y cordial con las personas. Está casado con Emerla quien es madre de su único hijo. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa.La actividad que realiza Jorge es el servicio de cuidado de la salud, para eso construyó un local en el interior de su vivienda donde instalo una farmacia, atendiendo de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ofreciéndoles promociones por sus preferencias, de esa manera está haciendo crecer su negocio.Se inició hace más de 05 años con un capital propio y con el apoyo de su pareja logra atender a sus clientes.Antes de comenzar con éste negocio no contaba con  ingresos propios y solo se dedicaba a estudiar, y con el apoyo de su pareja se decidió a empezar está actividad laboral con los deseos de ser un prospero empresario y apoyar con los gastos del hogar.Este será el segundo préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero brindado para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprarña medicamentos para su farmacia,  así como inmobiliarios para la recepción y la comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en: Jorge is 50 years old and is a hard-working and determined man.  He is also happy and cordial with people.  He is married to Emerla who is the mother of his only son.  Together they are comfortably living in their own home.  The work that Jorge does is the service of health care.  For that reason he built a store in the interior of his home where he installed a pharmacy.  He serves his customers in a kind and cordial manner, offering them sales for their preferences, and in that way he has been growing his business.  He began his business five years ago with his own capital and with the support of his wife they have served customers.  Before beginning this business he could not count on his own income and was only able to study, and with the help of his wife he decided to begin this work activity with the desire to be a prosperous businessman and to support household expenses.  This will be his second loan with KIVA and he thanks the lenders for the financial support given in order to help him get ahead.  He promises to comply with the repayment plan in a punctual manner.  With the requested loan of 3000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency), he will buy medicines for his pharmacy, as well as furniture for the reception area for the comfort of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Modeste

texts.en:
Modeste is a 26-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Modeste started selling lights in September, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife .

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Victoria Esforzada Group

texts.es: Maria, quien se encuentra al costado derecho de pelo corto rubio y lentes, es una socia del Banco Comunal Victoria Esforzada que se ubica en Concepción VIII Región de Chile, en donde existen rubros como el de abarrotes y bazares, y el negocio de María es el de abarrotes. Comenzó hace un año gracias a un dinero que su esposo recibió, y quisieron invertirlo en un negocio familiar, aunque aún les falta cosas por comprar para completar su negocio, ha debido enfrentar la ceguera de su marido consecuencia del terremoto ocurrido en el año 2010. El dinero que solicita lo ocupará en comprar más insumos y todo lo que les falta para completar su negocio, cree que pudiendo comprar todas las cosas que le falta podrá irles mucho mejor en su negocio. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es la posibilidad de poder conocer a más personas que están en su misma situación, se siente más acompañada, y el apoyo que hay dentro de la Fundación.
texts.en:
Maria, who is found on the right with short blonde hair and glasses, is a member of the communal bank “Victoria Esforzada” that is located in Concepcion VIII in Chile. In this area there are food shops and bazaars, in fact Maria has a grocery business. She started the business a year ago thanks to money that her husband received and they wanted to invest the money in a family business. Even though there are items they need to purchase to complete their business, they have faced challenges including her husband’s blindness that resulted from the earthquake in 2010. 

The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase supplies and everything they are missing to complete the business. She thinks that buying all the necessary items will improve the business. Her favorite part about working with “Fondo Esperanza” is the possibility of meeting other people in her situation. She feels more encouraged with the support that comes from the Foundation.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel attributes his success to the financing availed to him by Kiva and its partners. 

He is seeking his third loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Emmanuel started selling lights in July, 2012 and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a shopkeeper and chairman of the Nuru group in his area and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife and children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is a 51-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking his second Kiva loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Eugenie started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 50 lights to date (10 with the help of Kiva), providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife .

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Clodouard

texts.en:
Clodouard is a 50-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

 He is seeking his second Kiva loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Clodouard started selling lights in October, 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his children (Victoire, Marie Grace, Isidore, and Fidele).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is a 47-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking his second Kiva loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Alphonse started selling lights in October, 2012 and he has sold 30 lights (ten of which were funded by Kiva) to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his two children (Desange and Merisa).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
JOHN tiene 32 años es divorciado tiene dos hijos que no viven con el , vive con familiares en San Jose de Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

John necesita el dinero para la compra de electrodomesticos como refrigeradora y lavadora. El dinero le ayudado a comprar las cosas en efectivo.

Su sueño es tener dienropara incremetar el negocio. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
John is 32-years-old, he is divorced, and has two sons that do not live with him. He lives with family members in San Jose in the Chimbo providence of Bolivia. 

John needs money to purchase appliances such as a refrigerator and washing machine. The money will help him to purchase these items in cash. His dream is to increase his business. In his free time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase appliances such as a refrigerator and washing machine

loans.name: Sergio Alonso

texts.es:
Sergio vive en Chimbo es solero no tiene hijos.

Sergio es agricultor el dinero solicita para la comprar de semillas de papas y abono y fertilizantes para cuidar los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar el negocio. 

El sueño de sergio es tener dienro para comprarse un auto para la familia.

En los momentos libres le gusta salir con los amigos.
texts.en:
Sergio lives in Chimbo and is single without children. 

Sergio is a farmer. The loan he is requesting is to purchase potato seeds, manure, and fertilizer, to take care of the crops. The loan will help him to increase his business. Sergio’s dream is to have money to purchase a car for the family. In his free time he likes to go out with his friends.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, manure, and fertilizer to take care of his crops. The loan will help to increase his business.

loans.name: Cesar Gerardo

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 37 años es soltero vive con los padres en San Jose de Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Cesar se dedica al comercio de pollos de crianza como pollos y cerdos. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de balanceado de engorde y crianza. 

El sueño de Cesar es tener dienro para invertir en el negocio y construir chancheras grandes para poner los cerdos. En los tiempos libres le gusta descanzar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en: Cesar is 37 years old, is single, and lives with his parents in San Jose de Chimbo in the Province of Bolivar.  He works raising and selling small animals like chickens and pigs.  The loan that he is seeking will be used to purchase balanced feed in order to fatten his livestock.  Cesar's dream is to have money to invest in the business and to construct large pens for keeping the pigs.  In his free time he likes to relax and spend time with family.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed in order to fatten livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a fee to register her degree

loans.name: Jorge Andres

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 21 años es soltero vive en casa de los padres en San jose de Chimbo.

Jorge trabaja en Maxicarnes como vendedor el atiende el negocio el dinero necesita para la comprar de una computadora para el estudio para poder terminar de estudiar.

El sueño es tener dinero para seguir estudiando y ayudar a los padres.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los padres.
texts.en: Jorge is 21 years old, is single, and lives at home with his parents in San Jose de Chimbo.  Jorge works in the store "Maxicarnes" as a salesman.  He serves clients in the business.  He needs a loan in order to purchase a computer in order to be able to complete his studies.  His dream is to have enough money to be able to continue studying and to help his parents.  In his free time he likes to go out with his parents.

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Dorsy

texts.es: Dorsy de 44 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 4 a 16 años. Desde el año 2007 inició su propio negocio, imitando las actividades realizadas por su familia; Dorsy  en un punto comercial ubicado en su domicilio,  vende al detalle ranchos, víveres, cárnicos, lácteos, productos de la canasta familiar, consumidos por los moradores de su barrio, que se han convertido en sus mejores compradores, especialmente las amas de casa. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio en el que vende de contado, de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de a mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Sus ventas las realiza en el mercado de Cartagena, donde encuentra proveedores que le ofrecen mejores precios, cuando compra permanentemente y en volumen. Dorsy en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertirlo en arroz, frijoles, aceite artículos de aseo, con los que planea tener un mayor inventario y servir a su clientela para que siempre regrese a su tienda y para ella es muy satisfactorio porque con mas clientes mas utilidades..
texts.en: Dorsy is 44 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her partner and their three children ages 4 to 16 years.  Since 2007 she has been running her own business, imitating the activities realized by her family.  Dorsy sells items like chips, groceries, meats, milks and household products from a storefront located in her home.  People living in the neighborhood consume his products, and they have become her largest buyers, especially housewives.  Her goal is to grow her business, and she sells on credit, from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 2pm.  She makes her purchases in a market in Cartagena, where she finds sellers that offer better prices when she purchases in volume.  Dorsy currently is requesting a Kiva loan, her first credit with the Kiva field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest in rice, beans, oil and personal hygiene items.  With those items she plans to have a better inventory and to serve her customers so that they keep returning to her store.  For her it is very satisfactory because with more clients she has more income.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: El Prado Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL PRADO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mantillas, venta de ropa, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración prendas de vestir (costura y tejido); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió cuando llego de Brasil, con el deseo de tener su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella viven en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que se genera.
texts.en:
The community bank “El Prado” will begin its first cycle in “Pro Mujer” (For women) as part of “Centro Focal de Los Andes” (Focal Center of the Andes). It is made up of 6 members and is governed by a board of directors where Maria Eugenia is the President. The businesses that the members of the community bank have are various and include: food sale, sale of baby clothes, sale of clothing, sale of cheese. The loan they are requesting will benefit small micro-enterprises where Maria Eugenia is a member. She says that it is the first time that she is a member of “Pro Mujer.” She joined through an invitation from a promoter of the institution that went to her home. 

Currently, she has a business creating clothing (sewing and knitting). She started this business when she came from Brazil with the desire to have her own business.

The loan that she will take out is to increase capital (purchase fabric) that she buys from the wholesale distributors and will create and sell in her store. This form of work allows her to generate income to maintain household expenses. She has a civil union and two children. 

When she is asked what she likes about “Pro Mujer”, she responds that she likes the savings that she can generate.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Liliana Del Rocio

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 29 años es casada tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en San Jose de Chimbo.

Liliana se didica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas para luego vender rn libra o en pie, las compras las realiza en Guaranda en el mercado mayorista.  El dienro lo solicita para la comprar de balanceados y comida para los animales.


El sueño de de Liliana es tener dinero para dar la educacion a los hijos y comprar una camioneta para el trabajo.

En los triempos libres le gusta leer historias comicas. Y ayudar a los hijos hacer las tareas de la escuela.
texts.en: Liliana, 29, is married and has to children; she lives with her husband and children in San José de Chimbo.  She works raising pigs and chickens to then sell by the pound or live.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda’s wholesale market.  She’s asking for the money to buy feed and nutritional supplements for the animals.  Liliana’s dream is to have money for her children’s education and to buy a pick-up truck for work.  In her free time she likes to read humorous stories and to help her children with their school homework.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is a 41-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Aloys started selling lights in May of 2012, and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, and their six children.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Humberto  una vez mas, quien con su credikiva, compró lavadoras para remplazar las viejas, y tambien invirtió en mercancia variada como ropa calzado, accesorios femeninos etc. Humberto se ha beneficiado mucho, pues logró ofrecerles un mejor servicio con equipos nuevos a sus clientes. Por eso desde que recibió su credikiva, el negocio sigue sosteniéndose y su vida sigue mejorando con su familia.  Él dice a sus financiadores de kiva: "Muchas gracias por la ayuda y espero me colaboren otra vez". En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, porque planea vender nuevas mercancías como ropa, accesorios y calzado, para aumentar un poco su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Humberto once again.  He used his Kiva loan to buy washing machines to replace the old ones and also invested in varied merchandise like clothes, shoes, women’s accessories, etc.  Humberto has been much benefited because he managed to offer better customer service with new equipment.  This is why since he got his Kiva loan his business continues to support itself and life for his family continues to improve.  He says to his Kiva lenders:  “Many thanks for the help; I hope you will collaborate again.”  He’s currently applying for a new loan because he plans to sell new merchandise like clothes, accessories and shoes to increase his working capital a little.

loans.use: to buy clothes, accessories and shoes.

loans.name: Phocus

texts.en:
Phocus is a 33-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking his second Kiva loan of 30,000 RWF to purchase ten more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Phocus started selling lights in August of 2012, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Cecile, and their daughter, Joseline.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Suomo's Group

texts.en:
Martha, a single mother of one child, is the leader of 'Suomo' group. She lives in her parents' house in the center of Nungua town and sells maize (corn). From this business, she earns money to pay her child's school tuition and meet her basic needs. Her main clients are consumers from neighboring areas and retailers from the city. She is hardworking and committed to repaying her loan and maintaining the leadership of the group. The photo comprises six members and Martha is standing second from far right with white t-shirt and colored writing on the shirt. She is requesting 1,500 GHS to buy more maize (corn) to sell to customers.

The other members are Sekinatu, Ruby, Victoria, Mary and Elizabeth, who need a total amount of 3,850 GHS to expand their businesses. All the members signed waiver forms.

loans.use: to buy more maize (corn) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kisenyi Cell Ainebyoona Hand Craft Group

texts.en:
Provia is a resident of kisenyi cell in Mbarara municipality and is 35 years old. She became pregnant when she was in secondary three, at the age of 14, and because it was a taboo in her culture, she was chased from her parents’ home and sought refuge at her grandmother’s home. She then started supporting her grandmother in making handcrafted items, which was her grandmother’s main source of survival alongside farming. 

Using her small amount of savings, Provia managed to set up a crafts kiosk in the central market. She later obtained a loan of 500,000 UGX from Ugafode, which she used to expand her business. This has helped her to prosper and look after her children, which motivated her to mobilize women in her village to form a development group called Ainebyoona Hand Craft Group. This group has helped each other to succeed in their respective businesses and the members are requesting a loan to help them buy raw materials for their craftwork and expand on their businesses.

loans.use: To buy raw craftwork materials (beads, thread, etc.).

loans.name: Siempre Unidas Si Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE UNIDAS SI”  iniciará el trigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de shampoo, venta de ropa, venta de dulces, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, venta de CD’s, venta de cordero, venta de ropa interior.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s; mismo que inicia mediante los viajes constantes a la frontera Perú y Bolivia, observado que la venta de este producto era muy rentable decide contar con un espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de CD’s) que adquirirá de las ferias de la frontera Perú y Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y los ahorros
texts.en:
The “Siempre Unidas Si” (Always United Yes) communal bank will start its 38th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board whose treasurer is Marcela.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are shampoo sales, clothing sales, candy sales, neighborhood store, vegetable sales, CD sales, lamb sales and underwear sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Marcela.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for a year having joined thanks to an invitation from an aunt who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling CDs that she does making constant trips to the border with Perú and Bolivia.  Seeing that the sale of this item is very profitable, she’s decided to have a sales stand.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy CDs in street markets on the border with Perú and Bolivia to then sell in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her home the best way possible since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy CDs.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Pablo, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar todo tipo de frutas, con lo cual surtió bien su carretilla. Esto incidió positivamente en sus ventas, incrementando sus ingresos, y sus ahorros. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito con el cual espera agrandar su carretilla, y aumentar su surtido de frutas. Pablo dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por permitirme crecer en mi negocio y en mis metas”.
texts.en: Thanks for the support for Pablo, who with his previous Kiva credit was able to buy all types of fruits with which he supplied his cart very well.  This positively sparked his sales, increasing his income and his savings.  Currently he is applying for a new loan with which he hopes to expand his cart and increase the variety of fruits.  Pablo says to his supporters: "Thanks for allowing me to grow in my business and my goals."

loans.use: To expand his cart and increase the variety of his fruits.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year -old Fatmata from Tombo in western rural Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 21 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2003, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to get her daily feeding and move forward with her family. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business    .

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more local food, like peppers and palm oil, for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a local grocery store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food, like peppers and palm oil, for resale.
