The borrower is married with three children. They live in a three-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region, Cameroon. She has faced many challenges her life, including sickness, a bitter separation with her first husband and the deaths of her father, a group member and brother.

With this loan, she will buy crates, chairs and more wine to improve her bar. She believes the business will succeed because she has been doing it for many years and the community is in need of drinks. She believes the bar will be a good resting place for the community and that they will not have to travel long distances to buy wine or other drinks. 

With the profit from this loan, she will contribute, with her husband, to educate her children. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals. The loans are disbursed in times of need and the members are educated on management techniques before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy crates, chairs and wine for her bar.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a 41 year-old married woman. She has two children. She operates a green grocery where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is her first loan with Kiva partner SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz is 30 years old and married with 2 sons. Ayaz is raising sheep in Sabirabad, because mutton is a food in demand in this region. He has been in this business for 3 years. Since high school, Ayaz chose not to study, but to continue the family tradition and to become a shepherd. This is a very profitable business and Ayaz is doing it together with his father.

Ayaz sells the mutton in the city market. He raises the sheep and brings them to the central bazaar. He has plans to expand this business, because mutton is in high demand in the market, due to it being used in the traditional meals of Azerbaijan people. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

Ayaz has already taken out four loans from Aqroinvest and he has a good loan history .He is applying for the loan of 1,800 AZN. Ayaz believes that with this loan he can buy dozens of sheep and expand his business

loans.use: to buy more sheep and expand his business

loans.name: Ndack Diop

texts.fr: Madame Ndack Diop reside au Senegal. Son activité économique est la vente de produits cosmétiques et de tissus et cela fait plus de 05 qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle est mariée  et les revenus qu’elle obtient de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer à la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille. Elle est sociétaire de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant 200.000 francs CFA. Son financement sera destiné  a l’approvisionnement  de marchandises  a vendre. Ceci  lui permettra donc de renforcer son fonds de roulement  et de  mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et par la même occasion d’augmenter ses gains. Par conséquent, elle pourra avec ses bénéfices élever le niveau de son epargne et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle souhaite dans le futur disposer par le biais de son activité d’un toit pour sa petite famille
texts.en:
Ms. Ndack Diop resides in Senegal. She has beens selling cosmetics and cloth for over five years. She is married, and the income she obtains from her business enable her to help meet the needs of her family. 

She is an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches where she is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 francs CFA. Her financing will be used to stock up on merchandise to sell. This will then enable her to bolster her working capital and to satisfy customer demand further, as well as increase her profits in the meanwhile. 

Consequently, she will be able to use her profits to grow her savings and to improve her family's food situation. Through her business, she would like to have a roof over her small family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 49-year-old married man with 5 children. He describes himself as a patient man. He has been involved in business for the past 5 years. He is applying for a loan of KES 10,000, which will be used to purchase a cow to increase the production of milk. This is his 1st loan with SMEP DTM. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase the production of milk.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh vit au Sénégal. Il est père de famille et il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Sa spécialité est la vente de chaussures traditionnelles. A partir des revenus que lui génère cette activité, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Il est membre de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC au sein duquel  03 crédits antérieurs lui ont déjà été octroyés. Il sollicite a nouveau  un prêt de 600.000 francs CFA dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin qu’il puisse augmenter son offre de produits.  Grace à ce financement, ses bénéfices pourront accroitre  pour  lui permettre de rendre   meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et d’épargner plus d’épargne. Ultérieurement, il souhaite disposer d’assez de fond  pour démarrer l’élevage de bovin au niveau  de son village.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh lives in Senegal. He is a father, and he has been working in commerce for over ten years. His specialty is selling traditional shoes. With the income this business generates, he meets the needs of his family.

He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch in which he has already repaid three previous loans granted to him. He is requesting a new loan of 600,000 francs CFA with the goal of bolstering his working capital, so that he may expand his product offering. Thanks to this financing, his profits will be able to grow, enabling him to improve his family's food situation and to save more money. Beyond this, he would like to have enough funds to start raising cattle in his village.

loans.use: to order traditional shoes to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 26-year-old married mother of one. She describes herself as a patient and tolerant parent. She has been in the business for the past 3 years and describes her working environment as having potential. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES that will be used to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cereals as stock. The major challenge she faces is inadequate finance to stock up her shop. This is her second loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cereals as stock.

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr: Madame marieme habite au Sénégal. Elle est veuve et vit avec sa famille. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 30 ans et pratique la vente d’habits de friperie dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui ont lieu dans divers endroits de la ville. Elle est membre de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt pour un montant de 500.000 francs CFA. Ce crédit est le sixième qu’elle  a obtenu dans cette institution, et il est prévu pour l’achat de friperies destinés à la revente Son objectif est de satisfaire  la demande croissante de sa clientèle.. Cependant, l’augmentation de ses revenus  a travers ce financement pourrait  lui permettre  de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille et de faire plus d’économies. Son souhait est d’acheter une maison et de la mettre en location.
texts.en:
Ms. Marieme lives in Senegal. She is a widow  and lives with her family. She has been active in the business sector for over thirty years and sells secondhand clothing at the weekly markets, which take place at various locations in town. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA. This loan is the sixth one she has obtained from this institution. It is for purchasing used clothing for resale. Her goal is to satisfy the growing demands of her customers. 

Meanwhile, through this financing, the increase in income would enable her to meet the day-to-day needs of her family and to save money. Her wish is to purchase a house and rent it out.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothing to resell

loans.name: Farman

texts.en:
Farman is 54 years old and father of 4 children. He is a hard-working person who takes care of his family by doing business in animal husbandry. Farman grows cattle and raises them to sell meat. He has been in this business for 15 years. Farman's wife supports him in the business. Besides taking care of the children at home, she helps with feeding the cows and milking them. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. 

Farman sells the meat in the central bazaar, where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume meat a lot, because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. His profit is 120 AZN monthly.

Farman is applying for new loan of 2,000 AZN, in order to expand the business by buying new calves. He plans to grow these calves, fatten them and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying new calves

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old, married, and has three children ranging from 9 to 16 years old. She describes herself as tolerant. 

Lucy operates a green grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

Lucy will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more tomatoes, potatoes, and fruits to sell in her store. Her business goal is to expand her business to wholesale within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, and fruits to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 27-year-old mother of 2. She describes herself as an ambitious lady. She is applying for a loan of KES 50,000 that will be used to purchase flour, sugar, etc as stock. The challenge she faces is inadequate capital for her trade. This will be her 2nd application for a loan with SMEP DTM. She sees herself in the near future owning a cafeteria store in Nakuru.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, etc as stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is an innovative man who has been operating an onion business for the past three years in the Githurai area, which is highly populated and has an environment conducive to business. Peter is requesting his first loan from SMEP DTM for Kes 20,000 to purchase onions as stock for his green grocer. The anticipated profits will be used to pay for his child's education and expand the business into a wholesale store.

loans.use: To purchase onions as stock for his green grocer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 49-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 14 to 19-years-old. 

David describes himself as determined. He operates a grinding store where he grinds bones to make animal feeds. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are animal feed dealers. 

David says his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. He will use the 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) loan to to expand business by buying more equipment and bones for grinding. His business goal is to be a wholesaler supplier within five years. 

This is David's fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more equipment and bones for grinding.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 34-year-old married man with a child. He describes himself as a flexible and dynamic businessman. He has been in the business for the past 7 years and describes the environment as easily accessible. One challenge he faces is theft from his employees. The loan applied for of KES 40,000 will be used to purchase shoes as stock. This will be his 2nd loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase shoes as stock.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 34-year-old married woman with a child. She describes herself as a determined business woman and mother. 

Damaris has been running a boutique for the past three years and is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which will be used to purchase clothes for sale. Damaris will use any profits to improve her family's living standards. This is Damaris' first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 38-year-old married mother of 4. She describes herself as a determined and tolerant business woman. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 KES,  which will be used to purchase a cow to generate milk for her business. She also has a business selling milk, eggs, potatoes and kale. Her main challenge is inadequate capital for her business. This will be her 2nd loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase another cow to generate milk for her business.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children aged three and five-years-old. 

Wycliffe operates a retail store where he sells motor vehicle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for two years. 

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are vehicle owners. Wycliffe describes his biggest business challenge to be weather conditions. 

Wycliffe will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more vehicle spare parts for sell. His goal is to expand the business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Imamaddin

texts.en:
Imamaddin is 38 years old, married and the father of three children. Since ten years ago, Imamaddin has been running a store. He usually sells daily products in the store. There is tea, sugar, rice, candy, sauces, beans and other food items in his store. His wife is a housekeeper, but sometimes helps him to sell foods.

Imamaddin’s store is in the central market of Imisli. There are daily customers who come to purchase the items they need. His monthly income from the business is 250 AZN. He uses the money he gets from the store to take care of his children and also supports his relatives financially. He is person who always works hard in order to achieve more.

Imamaddin has taken a loan before Aqroinvest once. He has applied for a fifth loan of 1,300 AZN. With this money, he plans to purchase more food products.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Senaithy

texts.en: She was able to increase her stock by purchasing the cereals. Thus, she was able to expand her business to neighboring areas.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 39-year-old mother of one. She is located in Nairobi area and describes herself as creative. Eunice is applying for a loan of 90,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) with SMEP DTM. The loan will be used to purchase flour and sugar to increase stock for her food stall. 

The major challenge Eunice faces is inadequate capital funds to expand her business. She is also a farmer. This will be the third successive loan with SMEP DTM that Eunice has paid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar to increase stock for her food stall.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She is located in the Nakuru area and describes herself as a determined businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which will be used to purchase fish for resale. She has been in the business for three years and describes it as having potential. This will be her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 39 years old, and has four children ranging from 7 to 21 years old. 

Salome operates a poultry business where she raises chickens to sell, and has been in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. 

Salome will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy chicks and poultry feed for her business. Her business goal is to be self-reliant within five years.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Siporah

texts.en: Siporah is a 46-year-old woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a charcoal-selling business. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located suburban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of stock and buyers. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 6 and 10 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cattle and pigs. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Mary will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy animal feed, more dairy cows and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to own rental houses within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, more dairy cows and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has three children. She runs a general store, and describes herself as an ambitious and aggressive businesswoman. There are many potential customers in Nakuru, leading her to consider expanding her business. The major challenge she faces is an inadequate amount of funds to expand her business. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase rice, beans, sugar, and wheat to sell in her store. This will be her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, and wheat to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself as determined. 

John operates a mobile retail business where he supplies cakes and doughnuts to customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. 

John will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more cakes and doughnuts to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesale supplier within five years. 

This is John's fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cakes and doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Las Princesas Group

texts.es: Sixta es integrante del grupo Las Princesas, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes y acaba de iniciar con la venta de tamales, el crédito la ayudará a surtir su tienda con artículos como frituras, golosinas, refrescos, galletas y demás cosas. Sixta quiere que día con día crezca y produzca mucho mas en venta y ver su tienda muy bien surtida y mas grande. Las Princesas llevan 7 ciclos con su crédito y van por mas.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the group Las Princesas. She is married and has two children aged eight and four. She runs a grocery store and has recently started selling tamales [a corn-based dish]. This loan will help her to stock her store with items such as chips, candy, soft drinks, biscuits, and more. Sixta wants her shop to grow every day, to increase sales significantly, and to see the shop become bigger and well stocked.

Las Princesas have already completed seven loan cycles and are applying for another one.

loans.use: to stock her store with items such as chips, candy, soft drinks, biscuits, and more

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 33-year-old man. He has a child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables and also maize. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located in a profitable area, and his primary customers are suppliers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be diseases and pests. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farming inputs. His business goal is to increase his sales turnover within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farming inputs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 34-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a shoe retail store where he sells and repairs shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. His business goal is to own a big shoe shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama, une femme de 39 ans, fait du commerce de produits divers. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle vient renouveler  un crédit de 150000F CFA pour augmenter ses produits alimentaires tels que du poisson fumé et séché, de la pâte d’arachide, de l’huile de palme et d’autres produits susceptibles de générer un profit.
Elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison et de ses besoins personnels.
Grâce au crédit, elle peut désormais mettre de l’argent de coté. Elle a comme ambition de diversifier ses activités et d’ouvrir un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama, a 39-year-old woman, does commerce in a variety of goods. She is married and the mother of three children. She just renewed a loan of 150,000 francs CFA to increase her grocery products, such as smoked and dried fish, peanut butter, palm oil, and other products that might generate a profit. 

She supports her husband in covering household expenses and supports herself. Thanks to this loan, she can now put some money aside. Her ambition is to diversify her business and open a store selling grocery items.

loans.use: to purchase various grocery items, such as peanut butter, palm oil, ...

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aliou, âgé de 44 ans est transporteur de profession depuis plus de 5 ans maintenant. Il est célibataire sans enfant. C’est pour remédier d’ailleurs à ce statut de célibat qu’il vient solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour se marier ; pour cela il sollicite un crédit de 100000F CFA qui est d’ailleurs son 1èr crédit dans cette Institution.
Il participe à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et gère ses propres besoins personnels.
I l désire acquérir un autre véhicule pour pouvoir maximiser ses profits et gérer la famille qu’il veut fonder.
texts.en:
Mister Aliou is 44 years old and has been a trucker by profession for more than 5 years now. He is single and has no children. In fact it's to remedy this single status that he is coming to request support from UIMCEC to get married. For this he is requesting a loan of 100,000 FCFA which is in fact his first loan with this institution.

He contributes to his family's daily expenses and manages his own personal needs.

He wants to acquire another vehicle to be able to maximize his profits and manage the family that he wants to start.

loans.use: to get married.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 31-year-old married man. He has two children: a baby and an 8-year-old. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates an electronics shop and a money transfer service where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more electronics to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and also buy a car.

loans.use: to buy more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Aminata Sy Faye

texts.fr:
Aminata sy faye est enseignante âgée de 58 ans , elle démarre de 8h et termine 15h , mariée avec 5 enfants trois sont à l’université une fille en Europe et l'autre travail dans la fonction publique . Elle a capitalisé une expérience de 35 ans dans l'enseignement , avec ce crédit elle va acheter du ciment pour achever des travaux de la maison et la main d’œuvre des maçons . Aminata Sy faye avait bénéficié d'un crédit 500 000f qu'elle avait soldé sans problème.
Elle a comme projet future d'aller à la Mecque pour être une Adjaratou .
texts.en:
Aminata Sy Faye is a 58-year-old teacher. She starts at 8 AM and finishes at 3 PM. She is married and has five children. Three are at university, a daughter is in Europe, and another works in civil service. Aminata has capitalized on 35 years of experience in teaching. 

With this loan, she is going to purchase some cement to finish construction on the house and to pay the masons for their work. She had benefited from a 500,000 francs loan, which she settled without a problem. Her future plans include going to Mecca to be an 'Adjaratou' [title of someone who has gone on the pilgrimage to Mecca] .

loans.use: to purchase cement for her house

loans.name: Women With Faith Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Women with Faith” group from Waterloo, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 43-year-old is a widow with 2 children. She has been a businesswoman for many years now, and she sells slippers. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of slippers/flippers to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of slippers/flippers to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the “Women in Action” group. They are small scale businesswomen in Waterloo, a town near Freetown, the Sierra Leonean capital city. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their respective businesses and make more sales and a better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve. They can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Mamusu is the featured leader of this group. Mamusu was born in Makeni. The 44-year-old is married to a tailor and the two have three children. One is attending primary school and two are in secondary school.  Mamusu has been a businesswoman for many years now.  She sells market food – palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 35-year-old married man with two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a welding shop where he makes metal chairs and stools. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more welding materials and metals. His business goal is to open a big welding shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more welding materials and metals

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married woman and has seven children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unpredictable weather patterns. She will use the KES 15000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to own a ranch within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM having repaid the previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Milicah

texts.en: Milicah is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, ages 5 to 14 years. She describes herself as courageous. She operates a store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of buyers. She will use the KES 5000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to be a commercial seller within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mame Faty

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Faty, âgée de 54 ans est veuve avec 3 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. S on commerce consiste en la vente de friperie. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500000F CFA avec lesquelles elle pourra acheter cinq balles de friperie varié : soit des chemises, des pantalons, des habits pour bébé, des tee-shirts….
Mame Faty est une brave femme qui s’occupe de ses enfants et de leur éducation. C’est grâce aux bénéfices générés par l’activité qu’elle réussi à satisfaire leurs besoins.
Elle désire ouvrir un grand magasin de prêt à porter avec une augmentation de son capital et fond propre.
texts.en:
Ms. Mame Faty, aged 54, is a widow with three children to support. She has been active in commerce for several years. Her business involves selling secondhand clothing. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA so that she can purchase five bales of various used clothing: shirts, pants, baby outfits, or T-shirts… 

Ms. Faty is a good and honest woman who takes care of her children and their education. Thanks to the profits generated by her business, she is successful in satisfying their needs. She would like to open a big store for ready-to-wear clothing with an increase in her capital and her own funds.

loans.use: to purchase five bales of secondhand clothing to resell (shirts, pants, ...)

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a 34-year-old married man with three children. The eldest child is eight and the youngest is two years old. He is applying for a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase a second hand motorcycle for transportation. His boda boda business has been running for the past five years and now he wants to purchase his own motorcycle. Most of his customers are working people who need to be transported to their work places. This will be his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh est un homme d'origine peulh qui est né dans l'élevage. Depuis le bas age il pratique cet activité. Il évolue dans l'embouche, marié et père de famille il habite à  30km du Guichet. Monsieur Cheikh gère ses dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.Avec ce prêt il voudrait acheter des boeufs les élever et ensuite les revendre surtout pendant les fêtes religieuses. A l'avenir il souhaite avoir une ferme agricole
texts.en: Mister Cheikh is a man of Fulani origin who was born into breeding. He has practiced this business from a young age. He is progressing in animal fattening, married and a father. He lives 30 km from the branch. Mister Cheikh manages the daily expenses of his family. With this loan he would like to buy cows, raise them and then resell them especially during religious festivals. In the future he hopes to have an agricultural farm.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise them and then resell them.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa est une jeune femme qui commence à évoluer dans la confection des vetements de prêts à porter. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants,elle aide son mari dans la gestion des besoins de sa petite famille. Elle est débutante mais s'active très bien dans son activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 12h et le soir elle s'adonne à ses travaux ménagers. AWA sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tissus ensuite les confection en prêt à porter et les revende. Elle souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin et diversifier ses commandes.
texts.en: Ms. Awa is a young woman who is starting to make ready-to-wear clothing. She is a married mother of two. She helps her husband in managing the needs of her small family. She is a beginner but is quite active in her work. She starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at noon. In the evenings, she devotes her time to housework. Awa is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics for making ready-to-wear clothing to sell. She would like to open a big store and to diversify the special orders she receives.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to make ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread and weaving materials to make woven pagnes and resell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feed to resell

loans.name: Maloune

texts.fr:
Monsieur Maloune est  un boulanger de profession qui fait aussi de l’embouche à petite échelle .Il est marié mais ne vit pas avec sa famille car il les a laissé au village et est venu travaillé dans la ville.
Avec le crédit, il veut compléter  la somme qu’il a pour acheter une vache l’élever puis la revendre. Il a acquis une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Il a comme charges le payement de la chambre qu’il loue et  des frais d’électricité y afférents. Il envoie chaque fin du mois de l’argent à sa famille restée au village.
Comme projet futur il aimerait diversifier ses produits et services et augmenter le nombre de bêtes à élever voire allé jusqu'à avoir un ranch pour lui.
texts.en:
Mr. Maloune is a baker by trade who is also a small-scale livestock farmer. He is married but does not live with his family, since he has left them in the village and is here to work in the city. With this loan, he wants to round out the funds he has in order to purchase a cow to raise and then resell. He has acquired ten years of experience in this domain. 

His expenses include payments for a room he rents and the associated electricity bill. Each month, he sends money to his family back in the village. For his future plans, he would like to diversify his products and services, increase the number of animals to raise, and indeed go as far as owning his own ranch.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and then resell

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou est une grande dame agée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants . Elle loge en centre ville ou elle exerce aussi son activité de vente d’habits prêts à porter pour enfants. Métier qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans. Elle possède un magasin  qu’elle a ouvert avec ses propres moyens. Seulement là elle a besoin d’un crédit de 100.000F CFA pour compléter  quelques bagages manquants parmi ceux qu’elle expose déjà.
Elle aide son mari dans la  gestion des besoins de sa famille et la scolarité des enfants.
Et comme projet futur, elle veut agrandir son espace commercial et meme faire des voyages dans la sous région.
texts.en: Ms. Astou is a highly respected woman, 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives downtown where she also has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing for children. She has excelled in this trade for ten years. She owns a store that she opened with her own funds. In that regard, she just needs a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to round what she is lacking in her present display of goods. She helps out her husband in managing family needs and the children's schooling. For the future, she wants to expand her commercial space and even take trips in the area.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing to resell at the market

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty est une coiffeuse de profession, elle gere un salon de coiffure depuis 10ans. Elle habite à 7km du Guichet dans un quartier populaire ou le métier de coiffeuse est très prisé. Maty est mariée et mère de 3 enfants , elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et prend en charge ses propres dépenses. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter des tissus et parfums qu'elle se procure au niveau de la sous région comme la Mauritanie pour venir les revendre à ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 09h pour descendre à 20h du soir. A l'avenir elle veut devenir une grande commercante et avec l'aide de l'imcec faire des voyages au niveau de la sous région
texts.en: Maty is a hairdresser by profession. She has been managing a hair salon for 10 years. She lives 7 km from the branch in a popular neighborhood where the profession of hairdresser is greatly prized. Maty is married and mother to 3 children. She helps her husband to manage the daily expenses and takes care of her own expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and perfumes which she gets from the sub-region such as Mauritania to come back and resell them to her customers. She starts her day at 9am and finishes at 8pm at night. In the future she wants to become a great shopkeeper and with the help of UIMCEC travel in the sub-region.

loans.use: to diversify her business by buying fabric and perfumes to resell them to her customers that come to her salon.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Saliou, il est âgé de 35 ans marié et père de famille. Il gère une  boutique de denrées  alimentaires  depuis 3 ans.
Avec le crédit il va renouveler les denrées  qui sont plus rapides à écouler comme le lait, le thé, le sucre en poudre, les bouillons…
Avec  les revenus de ses ventes, Saliou s’occupe des besoins quotidiens des membres de sa famille. Il voudrait dans  le futur, diversifier  les produits et services.
texts.en: This borrower, named Saliou, is 35 years old and a married father. He has been running a grocery store for three years. With this loan, he is going to renew his inventory of supplies that sell the fastest, such as milk, tea, granulated sugar, bouillon cubes…. With the revenues from his sales, Saliou takes care of the day-to-day needs of his family members. For the future, he would like to diversify his products and services.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as rice, oil, sugar, and soap for his his grocery store

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 61-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 20 to 39 years old. He describes himself to be a go-getter. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are house builders. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constrains. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy tools for carving building stones.

loans.use: to buy tools for carving building stones

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr: Monsieur Seydou est un boulanger de profession mais en plus de son métier il pratique l'élevage.Il est marié et pere de 5 enfants; il gère ses dépenses familiales et a une expérience de 5ans dans cet activité. Seydou commence sa journée à 09 pour la terminer à 19h.Il demande ce crédit de 200 000 F pour acheter des moutons et des chèvres qu'il revende pendant les fêtes religeuses comme la tabaski et la korité. Avec l'augmentation de ses revenus il va améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et faire de l'épargne.
texts.en: Mister Seydou is a baker by profession but in addition to his profession he raises animals. He is married and father to 5 children. He manages his family's expenses and has 5 years experience in this business. Seydou starts his day at 9am and finishes at 7pm. He is asking for this loan of 200,000F to buy sheep and goats that he will resell during religious festivals such as Tabaski and Korité. With the increase in his revenue he is going to improve the living conditions of his family and save.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats which he is going to raise and then resell.

loans.name: Groupement Amy Sene

texts.fr:
Le GPF Amy  est un groupe qui s’est formé dans le voisinage des femmes du même quartier .Elle font du commerce et de l'embouche. La responsable du groupe s’appelle Amy qui a donné son nom au GPF, elle  fait de l'embouche depuis 6 ans .Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des moutons et de l'aliment de bétail qu’elle va revendre. Grace  au crédit, elle peut mettre de l’argent de coté et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle est mariée et participe à la dépense quotidienne. C'est elle qui a levé le carnet dans la photo
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir une grande ferme Agricole et diversifier son élevage.
texts.en:
The GPF Amy is a neighborhood group of women, who are from the same district. It is involved in commerce and in livestock farming. The group's representative, named Amy, who has given her name to the GPF, has worked at fattening livestock for six years. With this loan, she is going to purchase sheep and some animal feed and then resell them. 

Thanks to the loan, she can put some money aside and improve her family's living conditions. She is married and helps to cover day-to-day expenses. Amy is the one in the photo holding up a notebook. Her ambition is to start a large farm and to diversify her livestock farming.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and animal feed for livestock sales

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru: Наимчон житель северной части Таджикистана, города Исфары. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и у него есть маленькая дочь. Наимчон с женой и дочерью живет у родителей. Его отец работает сторожем на заводе по производству хлеба. Сам Наимчон работает мастером по ремонту автомашин в автосервисе. Он занимается этим делом уже 9 лет и является опытным мастером. У него очень много клиентов. За неделю Наимчон чинит около 8-10 автомобилей. Однако так как большая часть семейного расхода на его плечах, он нуждается в кредите для закупа запчастей для ремонта автомашин. Поэтому Наимчон обратился в организацию за кредитом и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Naimjon lives in Isfara, a city in the northern part of Tajikistan. He is 29 years old, married, and has a young daughter. The family lives with Naimjon's parents. His father works as a watchman at a bread factory. Naimjon himself works in an auto repair shop. He has worked in this business for nine years and is an experienced repairman. He has many clients and fixes around 8-10 cars per week. However, because most of the household expenses fall on his shoulders, he needs a loan in order to buy spare parts for his car repairs. That is why Naimjon has asked the organization for a loan, and he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for auto repairs

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Madame Aïssatou est une femme d'une cinquantaine d'année qui habite au environs du Guichet. Elle évolue dans le commerce de détail et vend des draps et de l'encens . Elle a une table au marché et a une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité:elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle aide son marie dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais scolaires.Elle commence sa journée à 09h pour la terminer à 18h.Madame Aissatou sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 10o.000F pour acheter des marchandises comme les draps et l'encens pour renforcer son commerce.Elle souhaite à l'avenir augmenter ses revenus pour ne plus avoir besoins de crédits pour travailler.
texts.en: Madam Aïssatou is a woman who is around 50 years old who lives near the branch. She is progressing in retail sales and sells sheets and incense. She has a table at the market and has 10 years experience in her business. She is married and mother to 5 children. She helps her husband to manage the family's daily expenses and the school fees. She starts her day at 9am and finishes at 6pm. Madam Aïssatou is requesting this loan in the sum of 100,000F to buy merchandise such as sheets and incense to strengthen her business. In the future she hopes to increase her income in order to no longer need loans to work.

loans.use: to buy sheets and incense to resell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 36-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 to 15 years old. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a cereals store where he sells maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraint. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco, la socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas,patos entre otros,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia lives in the Urubamba Province in the Cusco Department. She is a member of the communal bank Señor de Huanca and works raising small animals such as chickens, ducks, etc. She has been running this business for several years and it is going well thanks to her constant endeavor. 

Virginia raises these animals in order to sell them to her customers upon demand and she wishes to continue working in the same way so that she can continue to support her family. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy chickens for her business.

She is grateful to those who contribute to this dream through the loan program, and pledges to make her repayments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 21 years old and she is married with one daughter. Sabina is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sabina is a Jabrayili refugee.  She is very kind, caring and also very energetic in her work. Sabina raises cattle, fattens them and sells them for a profitable price. Her husband is the major support for her in this business.
She sells meat at the central bazaar for profits. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat, because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kababs, dolma etc. Her income from this business is 80 AZN per month. In order to fully support the family, Sabina is looking forward to expanding the business and making it very successful. 
This is the second time Sabina has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN in Aqroinvest, to buy four calves. Sabina at this very young age and with a great passion and energy plans to become a successful businesswoman in the town.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘gari,' a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched, powdered cassava. She usually sells her gari in Wafkrom, near the Cape Coast. She has been involved in preparing and selling gari for five years. Ama is married and has 7 children, and her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ama wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty gari. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es: Perla es una joven comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos por catalogo, usados y productos de belleza. Acaba de comenzar su crédito con el grupo Girasol y la ayudará a surtir mas ropa y zapatos, para de esa forma darle vuelta al dinero y ver mas ganancias en su negocio. Perla, vive en unión libre, junto con sus 3 hijos de 8, 7 años y 8 meses de edad, los mas grandes estudian la primaria. Ella desea salir adelante tanto en su negocio, como con su familia y apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Perla is a young businesswoman.  She sells clothing and shoes, both new from catalogs and used, as well as cosmetics.  She just took out her loan with Girasol Group.  The money will help her to stock up on more clothes and shoes so that she can reinvest in her business and earn greater profits.  

Perla lives with her partner, and her three children, ages seven, eight and eight months.  Her oldest two children are in grade school. She hopes to further her business as well as her family and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame  Aissatou  est  mariée  et  vit  dans  une  des  localités  du  Sénégal .  Elle  évolue  dans  le  secteur  du  commerce  depuis  15  ans   et pratique  la  vente  de  couscous  au  marché qui est situé non loin de sa maison. Les bénéfices générés s par son activité  lui  permettent  d’assurer  les  charges de   nourriture de sa famille. Elle  démarre  sa  journée   à  15 heures  et  descend  à  19 heures. Elle  a  déjà remboursé  15  prêts antérieurs. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit de   500000 frs prévu pour acheter du mil en quantité suffisante qu’elle pourra stocker et bénéficier de prix  d’achat en gros plus compétitifs. Aussi elle pourra aussi gagner du temps car elle n’aura plus à aller chaque jour au marché pour acheter son produit. Ainsi elle aura l’opportunité d’accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire, renforcer son épargner pour pouvoir réaliser son projet futur qui consiste à agrandir la cantine ou elle exerce son activité.   -
texts.en:
Aissatou is married and lives in Senegal.  She has been working in retail for the past 15 years, selling couscous at a market located not far from her house.  With the earnings from her business, she is able to feed her family.  She works from 3PM until 7PM.

Aissatou has already repaid 15 previous loans.  She is currently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy enough millet to benefit from wholesale, more attractive, prices.  She will store this millet and save herself some time, since she will no longer have to go to the market every day to buy supplies.  This will help her to increase her profit margin and boost her savings.  In turn, this will also allow her to carry out her future project: to increase the size of the stall where she sells her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy millet to prepare couscous for resale.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame   Bineta  est  une mère de famille  mariée  qui  vit  dans  une  des  localités  du pays.  Elle  s’active  dans  le  secteur  du  petit  commerce  depuis  10 ans. Son  activité  consiste à  vendre  des  bijoux (chaines  et    bagues).  Elle  a déjà remboursé 6 prêts antérieurs au guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs afin de renforcer son fond de commerce et augmenter la quantité de bijoux qu’elle commercialise. Son  objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité et accroître  davantage ses bénéfices. Son  intention est d’accroitre son épargne et disposer d’un local ou  elle pourrait exposer les bijoux qu’elle vend.
texts.en:
Bineta is a married woman and a mother who lives in Senegal.  She has been actively involved in small retail for the past ten years.  Her professional activity consists in selling jewelry (chains and rings).  She has already repaid six previous loans to the branch of the UIMCEC where she is a client.  

Bineta is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to boost her business and increase the quantity of jewelry that she sells.  Her goal is to make her business more profitable and to further increase her profits.

She wants to increase her savings and to have some type of commercial premises where she could display the jewelry that she sells.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Timbane

texts.fr: Madame Timbane est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle pratique la vente de vêtements de friperie et les revenus qu’elle obtient de cette activité lui permettent de contribuer à la satisfaction des besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Son expérience dans le secteur commerciale remonte quasiment a plus de 05 ans. Elle est sociétaire à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 400.000 francs CFA prévu pour augmenter  la quantité de marchandise qu’elle offre à sa clientèle. En effet, elle veut renforcer son fond de roulement et développer  son activité de commerce. Par conséquent, avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices, elle compte  élever son niveau d’épargne et rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Dans le futur, elle voudrait disposer  d’un magasin où elle pourra exposer ses articles pour mieux développer son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Timbane is a married woman who lives in Senegal.  She sells used clothing and is able to meet her family's daily needs with her earnings.  She has been working in this commercial field for more than five years.

Timbane is a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC, and she is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 CFA francs to increase her stock of merchandise for resale.   Timbane wants to boost her working capital and develop her commercial activity.  With increased profits, she is planning to save more and to provide better food conditions for her family.

In the future, she would like to have a store where she could display her goods, in order to better develop her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr: Madame  Véronique  est  une  femme  mariée  qui  vit  au  Sénégal. Elle est employée dans une école      depuis  10 ans. Parallèlement  pratique la vente d’écharpes tissés utilisées par les femmes pour leur habillement traditionnel. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 crédits antérieurs.  Elle   est   sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un prêt  de  700000 frs  prévu pour  renforcer son fond de commerce afin de développer son activité. Les  revenus  que lui procure son activité de commerce  lui  permettent  de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des frais du ménage et de développer son épargne. Dans le futur elle souhaiterait disposer d’un local ou elle pourra exposer sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Ms. Véronique is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been employed by a school for ten years. Concurrently, she sells woven scarves used by women in their traditional clothing. 

She has already repaid seven previous loans. She is an associate of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 700,000 francs for bolstering her business capital, so as to develop her business. The revenues her business brings in will enable her to support her husband in managing household expenses and to develop her savings. For the future, she would like to have a place where she can display her merchandise.

loans.use: to have scarves made in large quantities to sell

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr: Monsieur  Baba    habite  au  Sénégal  depuis  plusieurs  années. Il est marié et supporte les charges de nourriture et de paiements de facture de sa famille. Il  s’active  dans  le  secteur  du  service  et  est employé  comme   gardien   dans  une  structure   de  la  place depuis  6 ans. Il démarre  son  travail  à  8 heures  et  descend  à  17  heures. Il  est sociétaire au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC  ou il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs. Il a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Son financement  lui  servira  à  valoriser  son  terrain et démarrer la construction d’un  bâtiment. Son   ambition serait de construire l’intégralité de sa maison.  .
texts.en:
Mr. Baba has been living in Senegal for several years. He is married and covers the food costs and bills for his family. He is active in the service sector  and has been employed locally as a caretaker for a building for six years. He starts work at 8 AM and finishes at 5 PM. 

He is an associate at the U-IMCEC branch where he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs CFA. He has already repaid three previous loans. His financing will be used to develop his plot of land and start construction. His ambition would be to build his entire house.

loans.use: to begin construction on a building

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: La dame Aminata  est  une  veuve  qui  habite  au  Sénégal. Elle  s’active  dans  le  secteur  du  commerce  et  y  a  acquis  une expérience  de  5 ans. Son  activité  consiste  à  acheter des  tissus  pour  les  revendre à  ses  clients  dans  les  quartiers  de  sa  zone d’habitation. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 prévu pour la réfection  de   la  toiture  de  sa  maison  qu’elle  veut  donner  en  location. Les revenus de ce projet par conséquent lui permettront de pouvoir continuer la réfection de l’intégralité de la maison, ce qui est son principal souci.
texts.en: Ms. Aminata is a widow who lives in Senegal. She is active in commerce and has acquired five years of experience in it. Her business involves purchasing fabrics to resell to her customers in the neighborhoods where she lives. She has never had a loan from the U-IMCEC branch where she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for renovating the roof of her house, which she wants to rent out. The revenues from this project will consequently enable her to continue renovating the whole house, which is her main concern.

loans.use: to renovate her roof

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: La dame  Astou  est  mariée  et  vit  au  Sénégal.  Elle  évolue  dans  le  secteur  du commerce depuis  10  ans  et  vend  des  thioubs  (boubous  teintés) et  des  cheveux  naturels.  Elle est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC qui se situe non loin de là ou elle loge . Elle sollicite un crédit de 700 000 prévu pour l’achat de marchandises a revendre. Elle compte aussi  les diversifier en démarrant la vente de sac s a mains et de chaussures afin de répondre a la demande de sa clientèle. Avec l’accroissement de ses profits elle veut épargner de l’argent et aussi  participer a l’amélioration des  conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle  projette d’acquérir un  magasin.
texts.en:
Astou is married and she lives in Senegal.  She has been involved in retail for the past ten years and sells "thioubs" (dyed boubous) and natural hair.

She is a client of the UIMCEC branch located not far from here she lives.  She is requesting a loan of 700,000 francs to purchase some goods for resale.  She is also planning to diversify her business and to start selling handbags and shoes, in order to meet her customers' demand.

With increased profits, she wants to save some money and contribute to the improvement of her family's food conditions.  Her ambition is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy some dyed fabrics, natural hair, handbags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ibrahima  est  un  sénégalais  marié  qui  évolue  dans  le  secteur  de  l’éducation. Il est     instituteur  depuis  5  ans. Il  démarre  sa  journée à  8  heures  et  descend  à 17  heures.  Son  salaire  lui  permet  de  supporter  les  charges  quotidiennes de sa famille( nourriture et transport). Il souhaite avec son financement construire chez lui un local supplémentaire afin de rendre meilleur le cadre de vie de sa famille. Son projet futur consiste à terminer le chantier de sa maison.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is a married Senegalese man who is employed in the education sector.   He has been working as a school teacher for five years.  His working day starts at 8AM and ends at 5PM.  His income allows him to take care of his family's daily expenses (food and transportation).

He plans to use his loan to build an additional building on his property, in order to improve his family's living environment.  In the future, he plans to complete the construction of his house.

loans.use: to start building an additional building on his property.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: La dame  Maguette est   une  veuve  qui  vit  au  Sénégal  depuis  sa  naissance. Avec  une  expé-rience  de  10  ans  dans  le  secteur  du  commerce, son  activité  consiste à  vendre du  mil et  du  maïs. Il  démarre  son  travail  à 9 heures  et  descend  à 12  heures.   L’appui  financier  de  l’UIMCEC  pour  ce  premier  crédit  de  100000 frs lui  permettra  de  diversifier  les produits qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente de lait et de sucre. Les  bénéfices générés par son    son  activité  lui  permettent  de  supporter  les  charges  familiales ( nourriture,  règlement   facture ).  Il  projette  ainsi  avoir  sa  propre  cantine.
texts.en: Mrs. Maguette is a widow who has been living in Senegal since birth. She has 10 years of experience in retail; her business consists of selling millet and corn. [She] starts her work at 9 AM and ends at 12:00 PM. The financial support of UIMCEC for this first loan of 100,000 West African francs will allow her to diversify her merchandise, adding milk and sugar to her offerings. The revenues generated by her business allow her to provide for family need (food, bill payment). [She] hopes to open her own eatery.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Yei. Born in Sowa, the wife and mother of four children is a small-scale businesswoman in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Yei’s husband is a businessman, too, and three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools.  

Yei wants a loan of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) in order to invest in her business. She sells cloth – gara lappers (locally dyed cloths), Bamako cloth (cloth dyed in Mali), etc. 

Yei has been a businesswoman for seven years now. With the help of this loan, Yei will be able to further expand her business; she will use it to buy gara lappers and Bamako cloth in a large quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy gara lappers (locally dyed cloth) and Bamako cloth (dyed in Mali) in a large quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: Monsieur   Mor  est  un  homme  marié  qui  vit  au  Sénégal.  Il  est  ferrailleur   s’active  dans  le  secteur  des  services   depuis  13 ans. Il  démarre  sa  journée  à  9 heures  pour  ne  descendre  qu’à  18  heures.  Les  revenus  de  son  activité  lui  permettent  de  supporter  les  charges  de  nourriture de  sa  famille. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC  ou il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 en vue de construire une pièce supplémentaire dans sa maison. Il voudrait la rénover et rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son rêve dans le futur et construire intégralement sa maison.
texts.en:
Mor is a married man who lives in Senegal.  He is a scrap dealer and he has been working in the service industry for the past 13 years. He works from 9AM until 6PM.  With his income from his activity, he is able to cover his family's food expenses.

Mor is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC and he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to build an additional room in his house.  He would like to renovate his house and also improve his family's food conditions.

His dream is to complete the construction of his house one day.

loans.use: to build an additional room in his house.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: Monsieur  Mor  est  un  homme  marié  qui  vit  au  Sénégal .  Il  évolue  dans  le  secteur  de  la  couture  depuis   45  ans. Il a déjà remboursé 6 crédits au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre.  Actuellement il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour l’achat de tissus à confectionner et qui seront destinés a la vente. Ceci lui permettra de préparer les fêtes  de korité a l’approche du ramadan  qui s’annonce déjà. Elle consacre chaque jour 12 heures de temps a son activité. Par conséquent son intention est de mieux rentabiliser son activité pour accroitre ses revenus et finalement parvenir a    améliorer  les  conditions   alimentaires de la  famille. Il  projette  avoir  une  grande  entreprise  de  couture.
texts.en:
Mor is a married man who lives in Senegal.  He has been working as a tailor for 45 years and has already repaid six loans to the branch of the UIMCEC where he is a client.

Mor is currently requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy fabrics that he will sew and resell.  This will allow him to prepare for the upcoming celebration of Korité (marking the end of Ramadan).

Mor works 12 hours per day.  His goal is to make his commercial activity more profitable and to increase his income, in order to ultimately be able to improve his family's food conditions.  His ambition is to have a large sewing business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing and resale.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur   Babacar est  un  célibataire  sénégalais  vivant   dans  le  pays  qui  s’active  dans  le  secteur  du  commerce   depuis     15  ans. Il vend  des  sacs,  des  chaussures, des  bijoux  qu’il achète sur le marché. Les  revenus  que lui procure son activité l’aide a supporter  ses frais de transport  de même que ses besoins personnels. Avec  ce  premier  crédit  de  300000 frs  il pourra  augmenter   la  quantité  de  ses   marchandises  et  réaliser  des   bénéfices supplémentaires .Ainsi il pourra épargner davantage et améliorer ses conditions de vie. Il gère une cantine et démarre sa journée de travail à 9 heures pour ne rentrer chez lui qu’a 20 heures  le soir. Son projet dans le futur est d’acquérir une cantine qui lui appartient.
texts.en:
Babacar is a single Senegalese man who lives in his own country and who has been actively involved in retail for 15 years.  He sells bags, shoes and jewelry, which he buys at the market.  The earnings from his activity help him to meet his personal needs and cover his transportation costs. 

This first loan, of an amount of 300,000 francs, will allow him to increase his stock of goods and make more profits.  This will in turn help him to save more money and improve his living conditions.

Babacar manages a stall.  He starts his working day at 9AM and only comes home at 8PM.  In the future, he would like to own a stall.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Apolo

texts.en: Apolo is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married and has two children between the ages of 3 and 6. All of them go to school. Apolo runs a general store, and he has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is applying for a loan of 4,000 SSP to buy more beer and many other items.He has no source of income other than this business. In five years, Apolo would like to expand his business and open a depot. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Apolo says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beer and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Majit

texts.ru: Мачит житель района Хуросон. Ему 51 год. Он женат и является отцом пятерых детей. Его жена домохозяйка, старший сын инвалид, трое сыновей находятся на заработках за рубежом, а младший сын ученик средней школы. У Мачита высшее образование. Он по специальности инженер-техник и работал по профессии 20 лет. Последние 10 лет он занимается животноводством, а именно куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Кредит запрашивает для закупа 7-голов крупнорогатого скота и его корма. В будущем Мачит планирует заняться еще и птицеводством.
texts.en: Majit lives in the Huroson region.  He is 51 years old.  He is married and has five children.  His wife is a housewife, his oldest son is disabled, three of his sons work overseas, and his youngest son is a student in middle school.  Majit has a higher education and worked as a technical engineer for 20 years.  He has spent the last 10 years working with livestock, specifically the purchase and sale of cattle.  He has requested a loan for the purchase of seven heads of cattle and feed.  In the future, Majit plans to become involved in the poultry business as well.

loans.use: To purchase 7 heads of cattle and their feed

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es: La Joven Gladys, habita en el municipio de la Concepcion junto a sus padres, ella lucha dia a dia para poder cumplir su mayor sueño, mejorar sus condiciones de vida, desde muy joven trabaja la tierra cultivando citricos como: Limones, Mandarinas, Aguacates,  Naranjas, etc. con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara insumos y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a sus cosecha y asi aprovechar el agua de lluvia para riego, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado estos años.
texts.en: Young Gladys Estela lives in the municipality of Concepción with her parents.  She strives day to day to reach her greatest dream: to improve their living conditions.  She’s worked from a very young age growing citrus fruit like lemons, mandarins, oranges and avocados, etc.  She will use this loan that’s been granted to buy supplies and fertilizer to provide crop maintenance and take advantage of rainwater for irrigation.  She’s grateful for the help Afodenic and Kiva funds have given her through the years.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ibaidullo

texts.ru: Ибайдулло житель Яванского района. Ему 65 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих взрослых сыновей. Его сыновья уже обзаведены семьей, но живут все вместе в родительском доме. В данное время его сыновья находятся за пределами страны на заработках. Его невестки работают в дехканском хозяйстве, главой которого является сам Ибайдулло. Ибайдулло скромный, честный и трудолюбивый человек. У него среднее образование. Вот уже 18 лет как Ибайдулло занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. У него имеется 2 га земельного участка, на котором он выращивает в основном овощи и бахчевую культуру. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения минеральных удобрений. В будущем за счет прибыли с деятельности Ибайдулло планирует помочь сыну построить дом.
texts.en: Ibaidullo lives in Yavan region. he is 65 years old, married and has two adult sons. His sons both have families but everyone still lives in the same house. Currently Ibaidullo's sons are working abroad. His daughters-in-law work for the farming co-op which Ibaidullo is managing. Ibaidullo is a modest, honest and hard working man. He has a high school degree. He has been farming for more then 18 years and has 2 hectares of farm land where he grows vegetables and melons. He is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future Ibaidullo is hoping to use the profits from his farm to help his son build his own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Wendmalgre Markousi Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLAIRE  est responsable du groupe WENDMALGRE MARKOUSSI. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme vend des pommades, des mèches et des sacs à main depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne à grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont  les femmes de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 douzaine de sacs à main et 01 douzaine de pommade.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son hangar de vente  et scolariser ses enfants dans de meilleures écoles.
texts.en:
Claire is the leader of the Wendmalgre Markoussi group. Married, she is the mother of three children. The oldest child is seven years old and the youngest is four years old. Two of the children go to school. 

Claire has been selling ointment, hair extensions, and handbags for four years. She procures her goods at the grand market of Ouagadougou. Her customers are women from her area. 

She wants to buy a dozen handbags and a dozen ointments. 

Claire wants to save her earnings. She hopes to expand her shop and to send her children to the best schools.

loans.use: to buy a dozen handbags and a dozen ointments

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур житель города Куляб. Ему 35 лет. Он женат и является отцом пятерых детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети несовершеннолетние. Баходур занимается торговлей. У него на рынке города имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания, а также хозяйственные  товары. Он занимается торговым бизнесом на протяжении 15 лет. В бизнесе ему помогает дочь. Баходур запрашивает кредит для приобретения автомобиля  марки Opel с целью перевозки своего товара.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in the town of Kulob. He is 35 years old. He is married and is the father of five children. His wife is a homemaker, and his children are minors. Bahodur works in retail sales. He has a shop in the town market where he sells food and household goods. He has been in the retail business for over 15 years. One of his daughters helps him with his business. Bahodur is asking for a loan to buy an Opel automobile to transport his goods.

loans.use: To purchase a car to transport his goods

loans.name: Wend Pa Gouin Group

texts.fr:
Mme LIZETA  est responsable du groupe WEND PA GUOIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 07personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation  (dolo) depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Manga et à Kokologho. Ses clients sont  les hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de mil de 50kg et 03rangées de bois Pour la préparation du dolo (boisson local).
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. LIZETA is the official of the group WEND PA GUOIN. She is a married mother of eight children. The oldest is 40 years old, and the youngest is 20. None of them go to school, and she has seven persons to support. 

Ms. LIZETA has been making 'dolo' (a local beverage) for fifteen years. She gets her supplies in Manga and in Kokologho. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase two 50-kg sacks of millet and three batches of firewood for making 'dolo'. 

She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase millet and firewood for making 'dolo' (a local beverage).

loans.name: Sa'bagul

texts.ru: Саъбагулу 38 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает пятерых детей. У нее двое сыновей и трое дочерей. Она со своей семьей живет в Хатлонской области в городе Дангара. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. У Саъбагул среднее образование. Она работает уборщицей в профессиональном колледже. В свободное от работы времени Саъбагул занимается торговлей.  Она с рынка закупает ткани и одежды. Из тканей она она шьёт занавески и национальные одеяла и затем вывозит свой товар на продажу. Саъбагул занимается данной деятельностью на протяжении 3-х лет. Она берет кредит для закупа ткани и одежды на продажу.
texts.en: Sa'bagul is 38 years old, married and the mother of five children.  She has two sons and three daughters.  She and her family live in Dangara, a city in the Hatlon oblast of Tajikistan.  Her children attend high school.  Sa'bagul has a degree and she works as a cleaner at a professional college.  In her free time, she works in trade.  She buys fabrics and clothes at a market and sews curtains and national clothing.  She then sells them.  Sa'bagul has done this for more than three years.  She is taking out a loan to buy fabrics and clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and clothing

loans.name: Zainidin

texts.ru: Зайнидин житель района Рудаки. Ему 43 года. Он женат и является отцом четверых детей. В данный момент его старшие сыновья выехали на заработки за пределами страны. У Зайнидин среднее образование. Последние четыре года он занимается животноводством. Климат и природа его района благоприятствеует здесь разведению скота. Зайнидин является опытным скотоводом. Он закупает коров и овец, откармливает их в течение месяца и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. В деятельности ему помогает семья. Зайнидин берет кредит для купли и продажи скота (коров и овец).
texts.en:
Zainidin, aged 43, is a resident of the Rudaki district.   He is married and the father of four children.  His oldest sons are currently working abroad.

Zainidin has a high school education.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for the past four years.  The climate and natural environment of his district are favorable to raising livestock.

Zainidin is experienced in his field.  He buys cows and sheep, fattens them for a month, and then resells them for a profit at the cattle market.  His family helps him manage his business. He is taking a loan to buy livestock (cows and sheep) for resale.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale (cows and sheep).

loans.name: Ana Sulema

texts.es: La señora Ana Sulema, habita en el municipio de Masaya con su esposo e hijo, tiene su propio negocio que ocnsiste en compra venta de Cerdos, la señora Ana compra los cerdos los cria y luego los mata para vender  Carne, en su hogar, tiene tres años de estar en este negocio y quiere aumentar sus ventas,  su esposo trabaja para una empresa privada y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Cerdos, para que sus ingresos mejoren, agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindado con sus negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Sulema lives in the town of Masaya with her husband and child. She has her own business which consists of buying and selling pigs. Ana buys the pigs, raises them and then slaughters them to sell the meat from her home. She has been in this business for three years and wants to increase her sales. Her husband works for a private company and helps her with the household costs.
