The community bank Madres Unidas (Mothers United) meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for it's great diversity of local products such as, for example, the straw hats that are well-known within and beyond the country.
Diana lives in this place. She is 22 years old, married, and has a 3 year daughter from this marriage. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.
In addition to being a great wife and mother, Diana works selling all kinds of clothes. She sells door to door and also from her house when her clients go there. She works 3 days a week, mostly in the mornings. She sells on credit and collects payment every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil when she needs it. This business was started with the first loan that she received from the bank and known it enables her to make something on her own account. 
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. She has been with the community bank for 3 loan cycles and she likes it as she was able to start her business thanks to the first loan.
Her dream is to give her little girl the best.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Tsogtgerel

texts.en:
Borrower Tsogtgerel, 27, is a married man who lives with his wife and son. He supports his family by operating a men's clothing stall at an indoor market. Currently he has about 3,500,000 MNT in working capital. His wife helps to him to operate his business by importing clothes. Tsogtgerel usually sells jeans, belts and men's watches. 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell and increase his working capital. He is a really ambitious man who is willing to have his own property.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans, belts and watches to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Candelaria

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Gladys es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 18  años que se dedica a esta actividad y con sus ganancias a podido salir adelante ya que en ocasiones su marido no tiene trabajo o no  gana mucho en el campo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Madres Unidas (Mothers United) meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for it's great diversity of local products such as, for instance, the straw hats that are well-known within and beyond the country. 
Gladys lives in this place. She is 55 years old, married, and has 5 grown children from this marriage, 2 of whom still live with her. Her husband is a farmer. 
Gladys is a housewife who, in order to have her own income and to help her husband with the household expenses, sells all types of clothes and products from Avon and Yanabal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories.) She works 3 days a week for 2 or 3 hours a day. She sells her products on credit and makes collections every week. She has more than 18 years of experience doing this and the profits have enabled her to succeed because her husband sometimes does not have work or doesn't earn much in the fields. 
She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothes. She has been with the community bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help that they give with the loans. 
Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Mendbayar is a married lady who lives with her family in her sister's yard. She supports her family by operating a stationary, clothes and after-market selling business. Currently she has about 7,000,000 MNT in working capital. In the future she desires to increase her working capital. 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell.  Her aim is to own her own yard and house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is a 40-year-old, who lives with her family in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  She supports her family by operating a felt souvenir business.  She usually makes felt bags, saucers and sandals. Foreigners who are travelling in Mongolia are her customers.
 
Sarantuya distributes her goods to local indoor and outdoor markets, stalls, whole suppliers and souvenir shops.  Summer is the very high shopping season for her business because a lot of tourists come here to travel and they do shopping through souvenir shops.  Thus she is requesting a 4,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase felts to make her goods for sale. In addition, she is a very trusted client of our institution and this is her second Kiva loan.  She really appreciates Kiva loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as felt, to make a variety of souvenirs.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Los Girasoles es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras y alegres, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con el objetivo de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, Blanca Estela venta de ropa, Maria Isabel venta de accesorios de plata, Luz del carmen venta de antojitos, Flora venta de ropa, Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tierra Blanca y decidieron llamar a su grupo los girasoles ya que hay una florería cerca de la casa de reunión y el día que se formo el grupo había muchos arreglos florares con girasoles.
Blanca Estela uno de los integrantes de este grupo tiene la edad de 28 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y esta casada, ella platica que hace un poco mas de un año decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio con la intención de tener una entrada de dinero extra en su hogar, ella realiza ventas de ropa ambulante por las tardes con sus amigos y vecinos, ella ademas por la mañana trabaja, entonces en sus tiempos libres aprovecha para salir hacer sus ventas, ella esta muy contenta ya que su negocio poco a poco esta ganando clientes e incluso como ya saben que ella vende  van a buscarla a su casa para ver sus productos y hacerle el gasto. 

Ella ha solicitado este crédito a Vision Fund para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de camisas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas,faldas, shorts, playeras y ropa interior para continuar con sus ventas. 

ella quiere que su negocio continué progresando y en un futuro le gustaría establecerlo. 

Este grupo agradece el apoyo que Vision Fund le ha otorgado al brindarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
"Los Girasoles" is the name of a group made up of four enterprising and happy ladies.  Each of them has her own business so that they can improve their families' quality of life.  Blanca Estela sells clothing, Maria Isabel sells silver accessories, Luz del Carmen sells snacks, Flora sells clothing.  This group is located in Tierra Blanca and they decided to call it "Girasoles" (Sunflowers) becasue there is a flower shop near the house where they meet and each day there were many arrangements with sunflowers.

Blanca Estela is one of the members.  She is 28 years old and has a secondary school education.  She is married and says that she decided to start her own business a year ago, in order to have a way to bring extra money into her household.  She sells clothing on foot to her friends and neighbors in the evening.  She also works in the mornings and takes advantage of her spare time to go out and make more sales.  She is very happy that her business is growing little by little and is bringing in more customers.  The look for her in her home in order to buy from her.

She is asking for this loan through Vision Fund so she can buy a variety of shirts, blouses, dresses, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, polo shirts, and undergarments so she can continue her sales.

She wants her business to continue improving and become established in the future.

The group is grateful to Vision Fund for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 37 years old. She is widowed and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Due tao  lack of funds, Sina is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase bricks and rocks to build a fence around her house. This money will help improve her family’s security. 

In the future, Sina would like to cultivate vegetables to sell and send her child to a good school.  Moreover, she hopes to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and rocks to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Teresa Del Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mini Bankito se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es maestro.

Doña Teresa es maestra y tiene un jardín de infantes, en el cual con la ayuda de 4 personas que les paga un sueldo mensual cuidan y educan a muchos niños. Ella en su tiempo libre  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, actividad que realiza puerta a puerta, también les vende los uniformes a sus alumnos y ciertos útiles y materiales que ellos utilizan en su día a día. Tiene más de 8 años su jardín de infantes y dedicada al comercio más de 3 años, actividad que le deja muy buenas ganancias sobretodo en época de entrada a clases ya que es cuando más vende.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar uniformes, medias y ropa interior que utilizan los niños en entrada a clases. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.

Su sueño es seguir adelante brindando la mejor educación a sus pequeños ya que le encanta lo que hace.
texts.en:
The "Mini Bankito" communal bank meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa. This canton is known as the "Queen of Coffee," thanks to its extensive plantings of coffee which has an incomparable flavor. The canton is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

In this place lives Teresa, who is 42 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two children, aged 12 and 10, who are in elementary and secondary school. Her husband is a teacher. 

Teresa is a teacher and has a nursery school. With the help of four people to whom she pays a monthly salary, she takes care of and teaches many children. In her free time, she works selling clothing of all kinds. She does this work from door to door, and she also sells uniforms to her students, along with certain materials and supplies that they use day to day. She has run her nursery school for more than 8 years, and she has been a merchant for more than 3 years. This activity provides her with very good earnings, above all during the time when classes begin, since that is when she sells the most. 

She will use this loan to buy uniforms, socks and underwear which the children use at the beginning of classes. She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her. 

Her dream is to continue providing the best education to her little ones, since she loves what she does.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, socks and underwear to sell.
